text: Gone down hill after new owners wooden fence that blow down in storm has not been repaired in mouths grass on bank has not been cut all year and is grow up making a perfect place for rodents and if you are older you need to think twice because if you need anything taken care of in your apartment you can’t call the office you have to go on line and put in a work order they want your rent money but after that taking care of the tenant it secondary

name: AJ
text: I’ve viewed their one bedrooms and I’m in love with the layout! But their prices are waaaay too high especially with nothing included and no updated appliances. I would really love to live there so hopefully the prices will go down in the fall.

name: Remedy Chiks
text: The one bedroom units are nice and spacious, they have easy access to I-65 but for the area, they’re pricey. For the calera area the price should be under $800, or at least have utilities or something included. Apartments in the alabaster are the same price but have internet/cable included and are surrounded by plenty of shopping choices so they’re worth the price.

name: Colby Key
text: The apartments are ok to live in but maintenance is horrible. Don’t expect any help unless they are at the property. I’ve had light switch issues In my kitchen for months and they have still yet to fix the problem because, “it was like that when we moved in”. It wasn’t like that when we moved in because I could flip the switch and it would work. Even if it was like that when I moved in it’s not functioning correctly and they should’ve fixed it. Now my other switch in the kitchen doesn’t work. Can’t turn the lights off without flipping the breaker or taking the bulbs out. Great service maintenance! Like always I’ll fix the problem myself. I’ll keep paying you to take it easy.

name: Cindy Werner
text: I have lived here since April of last year and have LOVED it!! I have never waited more than a couple of days for maintenance (usually come the day  I make the complaint) and they are incredibly nice.  Also, the office staff has been wonderful as well.  I honestly didn't have the highest of hopes when we moved here, but it has truly exceeded my expectations.  I have recommended them to friends as well.  The grounds are pretty. They are pet friendly.. just a wonderful place to call home.

name: Amy Jackey
text:
Nothing but good to say! It's quiet. Maintenance is beyond fast and easy. You set the request through the app for the complex and short time later you get a message that it's done. The office staff is very friendly but professional.

I have recommended this place to SO many.

The grounds are kept very nicely, pool is beautiful, workout room and laundry facilities are clean.

My only negative is my counters in bathroom and kitchen are very outdated and kitchen floor needs replacing. Otherwise it's great in the apt.

Strongly recommend. I've been here for 5 months and this is my HOME.

name: Stink Palm
text: This is a great place to live. I have lived for here 4 years now.Never had any problems, it’s quite clean and you can actually use all the facilities they offer. Nice pool, great staff, if I ever had any thing that needed to be fixed I called the office and they had it fixed very prompt.its also a great place for kids nice Park.its near Walmart and Publix.the staff here are great and very helpful.the apartment are nice clean fresh paint and new carpet when moved in and super clean. They also care about the grounds and they are very respectful about your needs.give them a chance u won’t regret it.

resp.text:
We appreciate your time in reviewing our community,Stink.  The staff and I are happy that
you’ve enjoyed your stay here at Lancaster Place.  We’ve enjoyed having you as
a resident! Your kind note has really made our day and we promise to continue
to offer the highest standards of apartment features and community amenities.
Feel free to contact us at (205) 476-0050 if there is anything at all we can help with.

name: Alabama Crappie Adventures
text: We are having mice in our apartment. Someone please contact me asap! Apartment 727. We don't know if they are coming from another apartment or a hole under the sink, but this needs to be addressed. This is day 3 having mice running through the apartment. Glue Traps are not working. We need maintenance to stuff the holes with some wool or something please. Thanks, Brian

name: Andre Lacey
text: I've been living there for a month now and my experience with the staff was and has been great so far. I enjoy my new apartment, and all of its amenities.

name: j milwood
text: Decent looking apartments and the management is pretty good.way to many ADDITIONAL fees to add to your bill at the end of the month to make your bill well above $1100. Also there is no o red light at the front entrance of a very busy and fast moving highway at this complex and someone will eventually get badly hurt if they haven't already.

name: Sulmorko Nightstorm
text: Great place. Staff is wonderful. The maintenance staff is on point. Would totally recommend living here. We will probably be here for years!

name: Jamye Morris
text: Great place to live.  Brandon in the office is awesome!  He is always so friendly and helpful.

name: adrienne williams
text: So much to say where do I start. You pay for trash service and they barely pick up your trash. Next you pay for pest control but bugs are all over the place. Then when you request maintenance they come when ever they feel like it no rush to help. The apartment above me flooded into my laundry room causing leakage into my circuit breaker. And to fix that they dried it out with a fan. Mold has started to grow in the laundry room I told them and as usual nothing was done. I had 2 floods and now my apartment smells like sweaty gym shoes. The worst part is the college boys that moved in. The college boys are loud, rude, inappropriate with 13 year old girls, they never go to bed keep up working people. When we asked to break the lease for all these reasons we were told we would have to pay. My daughter bike was recently stolen right off our patio I walked around the complex and there it was laying in someone else's yard. You pay all this money to be uncomfortable and forced to stay because they make it impossible to afford to move. I wouldn't advise any hard working family to live here. Living here is like a  fraternity house. Worst place I've ever lived. Oh and let me not forget to mention they barely answer the phone. You have to go to the office and they are just sitting there so why wasn't the phone being answered.

name: Aquarius X2
text: My brother's apartment on ground floor was flooded from 3rd floor at 3:30 am on September 13 Tuesday. He and I were both promised maintenance and cleaning that day. Here we are September 14 Wednesday 7 am. 27 and a half hour later NOTHING!! No hotel provided! This is not a little flood. Not a single room in his apartment isn't wet!!

name: Chanda Mitchell
text: Seems really crowded, but the pool is nice and I've heard the management is nice. I don't live there though

name: Taylor Woodall
text: Have had nothing but bad experiences, apartment flooded after 2 weeks into moving in, (from 3rd floor all the way my the bottom floor, where I'm at) now 2 months later still have half unfinished walls, they came into to paint the first time unannounced(after requesting numerous times to be notified before coming to paint since I am pregnant) You pay monthly for pest control and then get told that they only spray twice a year, they can spray once a week but you have to request it. Needless to say my apartment is infested with ants, coming out of cracks in the walls, and if I pay every month for a pest service of course I want to apartment sprayed. Office people are rude.

name: TERRY HENLEY
text:
I stayed there in 2015. The only thing I can say  negative about my stay is, I didnt feel safe most ot the time when I left my apartment. Other than that I had a great stay. It is near everything. I played around with the staff and manager who was very to me. I must give the two men, cant remember their names, who kept the apts in good repairs a raise. Thanks for keeping my apartment in good shape. If I had a complaint, never had too wait hours or day for you guys. My hat off to you, because I dont know how the owner or owners expect two person to take care of such a large amount of apartment that you have. If several apartment are flood, refrid out, air cond, out stove dont work, etc How are they to be there on time for all the people. Some people are not willing to wait when things stop working. I suggest you hire more laborer when you are booked up and let some take time off when things are slow.  Dont you care about letting your guest suffer like they do, so they have to write such bad things about. Just hoping you stay in business. The place was in good shape when I was there. Looks like the last year was bad.
Just happen to see your web review and thought I would add my two cents.

name: Rosalyn King
text: This the worst place to stay.  I suffered a really bad experience here, this place is the luxary hood.  They have a group home of college boys staying at the faciliy.  I feel is so unappropriate, for a family environment.  The apartment is infested with bugs.  The manager is so unprofessional and so is the other lady, they run through staff.  Did I mention that the bugs there are horrible.  When pest control is suppose to be spraying they aren't spraying.  DON'T GO HERE.  I REPEAT DON'T GO HERE.................

name: Nathan
text: I wouldn’t quite say luxury, but over all our stay has been fine.

name: Christine Colmenares
text: Amazing apartment complex

name: brittany mitchell
text: Management is awful

resp.text: brittany, please reach out to the Lancaster Place staff at (205) 476-0050 so we can address your concerns directly.  We are sorry we have not met your expectations and we will do our best to remedy that.

name: Christy Hargett
text: Never been there

name: Paula Riddle Wright
text:
Absolutely love staying at Sugar Beach Condos we always rent from Don Taylor
We’ve been coming for yeas well at least 24 years wouldn’t stay no place friendly
courtesy we love staying Wish I could retire there someday soon Don’t Forget to try
Lartigues acroos the road they’re food is #delicious

name: Karen S
text: We have been very happy with anchor vacations.  The girls in the office are always helpful and friendly.  We had a couple issues of things that needed fixing.  It was dealt with quickly.

name: StanCulpepper
text: Great place to stay on the beach . Very clean place for the family

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Hope you return for another visit next year:)

name: Emily Bell
text: The staff at Anchor is FABULOUS! They went above and beyond for me when my reservations with Meyer Realty was cancelled last minute. Then, my husband had unexpected surgery just 4 days before our trip, and they were MORE than accommodating to our situation. I cannot recommend them enough and will definitely be staying with them again!

resp.text:
Emily,
We are happy to hear that our staff members took priority in helping you find alternate accommodations. Hope your husband is recovering and doing well. We look forward to hearing from you when you are ready to book your next vacation:)

Thank you so much for the review!
Anchor Vacations

name: Mary Mathis
text: I just read a review done years ago by another Google user.  I had to add here that I have been using Anchor for 3 years now and I have been amazed at the quick response one gets to any inquiry by email or phone.  Not only was I pleased with the home we stayed in, all the family loved it too.  I found each home, we have used in the last few years to be exactly as pictured, clean, up-to-date furnishings and would recommend highly to any looking for a sweet, quiet stay at the beach.  These are good people and they work to make your stay really comfortable.  I have been really REALLY pleased each year!

resp.text:
Mary,

I would like to take a moment to thank you for your very kind review. I am so happy to hear how pleased you have been with each rental you have stayed in. We enjoy working with you and look forward to your next visit!

Sincerely,
The Anchor Vacations Team

name: Jonathon Kerr
text: They just cancelled my reservation, now with 8 weeks until my reservation. They tryed to help by offering a more expensive play to stay. And they really could have tried by offering some type of discount for my troubles. I would look elsewhere before renting through anchor vacations!

resp.text:
Jonathon,

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. Unfortunately, this is out of our control as this particular unit sold. The Owner will be renting later in the year but is having the unit completely remodeling!

name: Dawn Luther
text: We stayed a couple of weeks ago and the view and condo was great! Air worked perfect (saw some older reviews). And the updates were absolutely beautiful! Old pics online do not do it justice! Beware of the awful answering service if after hours but the place is really nice! Will stay again.

resp.text:
Dawn,

We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the condo and your stay. We will be sure to address issues with the answering service as well. Thanks for the review and we hope you return for a visit soon!

name: Rick Lawson
text: Could not have found a more pleasant vacation home.  Clean and comfortable with  a cordial expression throughout.  We were impressed with the detail furnished by the owner, such as extra light bulbs, pillows, and comforters.  Obviously, professionally decorated with a beachy feel and welcoming ambiance, we took pictures to consider changes back home.  Though we didn't cook much, the kitchen was fully furnished right down to the appropriate stemware.  Traveling almost 200 days a year, we have no reservations about recommending this condo and look forward to a return visit in the winter.

resp.text:
Mr. Lawson,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and your accommodations. We look forward to working with you again!

name: Allie Caldwell
text: We stayed in a condo located in Orange Beach through this company, and I would not recommend. The dishes were not clean upon arrival. The air conditioning was entirely too loud, to the point it startled you when it would come on. The microwave also sounded like it was going to blow up. The Anchor Vacations workers were not helpful either. This was not worth almost a thousand dollars, at all.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize for the issues. Please note that any housekeeping issues can be addressed if reported to us. We will notify maintenance to check the microwave so we can get that replaced. As for the ac, it was replaced last year so the unit is new. We did have a similar complaint so we did send an ac tech to check the issue. There were no issues reported by the ac tech. We do sincerely apologize and appreciate your review.

name: Melly Ann
text: Stayed here a year ago. They were perfect! Addressed any issues we had and were a great company to use! Will be using them again!

name: Dustin C
text: Great rental and very nice people.  Took advantage of all additional amenities.  I will rent from again in the future.

name: Susan Moorefield
text:
when we first arrived at our home we noticed trash and such underneath the house apparently vagabonds were making good use of this place apparently while the house wasnt being checked on.
When contacting the office to alert them of the situation we were told a maintenance person would be there to take care of all the debris, that was not the case. We waited for hours for them to clean and we ended up doing it our selves. Another interesting piece is the neighbors on both sides of us came to us to warn us that vagabonds had indeed been camping out there underneath and showering, we were also told that Anchor vacations was alerted to this. According to Anchor of course they say they were not alerted, but Im inclined to believe the neighbors afterall there was trash and showering items stating apparently someone was utilizing said underneath.
When I called to express how I felt about this, I was only given a $40.00 cleaning refund.
So this goes without saying this is my first and last time booking with Anchor.  My feeling is had they checked on this place before we got there they would of seen the mess an hurried an cleaned it up, it states to me that they really dont care about the properties. I would venture to say that today unless someone else alerts them that vagabonds our indeed camping out there they are not the wiser. We felt very unsafe at the Happy Clam.

name: Google Account
text: The lady who handles booking is very rude! We were trying to book for an available rental, then when we called she said that she couldnt accommodate are needs. But, she told us through several emails that she would be able too...We never had this issue with other property managements.We will never use them or refer this management to anyone...We are frequent renters too!!They need to fire the booking agent for lack of knowledge!

name: Sierrah Puckett
text: We stayed here in room 409 this past weekend from May 25th-May 28th.  Overall I cant say a whole lot about the accommodations. When we booked the room, being as it is to sleep up to 6/7 people, we were told that two parking spots came along with the booking. When we got there to check in, we found out that we had to pay additional fees for any vehicles. Not a single one was included in the booking cost. Not even 24 hours in we had problems with the room keys not wanting to let us in. Some times it would blink red, sometimes it didnt register at all. We had to go to the office 4/5 times to fix the issue. Finally they replaced the batteries in the main lock. The office staff was rude, pissy, and didnt have much interested in helping their guest. Lastly, upon leaving, we did the courteous thing by sweeping majority of the tracked in sand up,  wiped down counters, made sure all dishes had been ran and washed, and so forth. Left, turned out keys in. And headed home. Today May 31st we are charged $110!! after speaking with someone at anchor, who didnt know why, she contacted the condo then gave us a call. These people are trying to say that they have pictures of ashes and cigarettes butts all over the room, and claiming they had to strip everything down due to the smell of smoke. Mind you we have small children in this room under the age of 5!!!!! Not once was a cigarette brought into that room and we are extremely disappointed with the way this is going. Might I add we were also charged another $40 for them to wash the comforter! The cleaning policy clearly says fresh linens are included and any additional cleaning will be extra. There was not reason to be charged extra! We will be doing everything in our power to have our bank reverse the charges as they are FAULTY!!! We will not be booking again, and would never recommend the condo to anyone!!!!

resp.text:
Sierrah,

We sincerely apologize about the issues you faced with the key cards to the condo and the onsite office staff. We will be sure to talk to them about how they speak/deal with guests directly. We do appreciate you taking the time to clean up upon departure. However, we were notified by housekeeping and given pictures with proof of ashes in the bedroom. Therefore, we did charge for the smoke elimination and to have the comforter washed as we had a guest due in the very next day. Upon your request, we did email these photos to you immediately. Please know housekeeping staff is required to take photos for proof if any additional charges are going to be charged towards the guest. As for the parking, it does state online in the description that the complex allows up to 2 vehicles except for during holidays and big events then it is limited to one. Parking is to be purchased onsite at the main office. We apologize for the confusion.

name: Seth McGuinness
text:
We rented a house from them that had the A/C unit out and the house was 93 degrees inside. The house also had many issues that were conveniently left out of the pictures - bathtubs had mildew and refrigerator was stained and dented. They sent an A/C repairman to fix it and he said the A/C was shot, but he patched it temporarily.

We had a 3 mo. with us, that we were concerned about and the heat index was 110 all week we were there. They ultimately moved us to a new house, of there choosing, but attempted to force us to move back upon our objection that we did not feel the house was safe for us to stay in because of the A/C and the extreme heat and the danger it could pose to our daughter if it went out as the A/C man said it could. Also, we were not excited to be dealing with the situation throughout our entire vacation.

I mentioned that they moved us, but it was to a more expensive house, which they chose. We just asked to be moved. They attempted to force us to move, or pay the additional price. We said that was not what we were comfortable with and that we'd use our trip insurance or ask for a refund. Their response was to show us the rental agreement that said A/C is not guaranteed and would not be eligible for a refund or insurance.

The employees who we talked to always said it was not their decision but someone named "Donna". We never were able to talk to Donna, even though they said she was the owner. We requested several times and were told she would call us, but the employees would call us back.

They were borderline harassing us about this and ultimately, quit harassing us when they charged my card for an additional balance I did not authorize. It was an absolute mess of a trip because of them and I do not recommend them at all.

resp.text:
Mr. MCGuinness,

I do apologize for the issues you experienced during your stay. Once we were notified of the issue with the A/C, our employees sent out the A/C repairman to resolve the issue. As a courtesy, you were moved to a gulf front unit for two nights until we were sure the repairs to the A/C were complete, with the understanding that you would be moved back to the unit you rented. Once the issue was resolved, you were asked to move back to the property rented or pay for the gulf front unit. You chose to stay in the gulf front property which then resulted in the additional charge to your credit card.

name: Ron DeYoung
text: Good  place do deal with

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!

name: Robert Calhoun
text: I lived in downtown Auburn, renting from Badger Properties.  Without a doubt, it was one of the best rental companies that I have used in Auburn.  Apartment complex was very well maintained.  The atmosphere was quiet, perfect for a serious student.  Also, I loved how convenient it was to walk to central campus and downtown.  I recommend Badger Properties to anyone looking for housing in the Auburn area!!

name: J. Keith Maxwell
text: I stayed in Center Court this summer for a temporary situation. I had top notch service from Chris Kearns and Jason at Badger Properties. I would highly recommend Badger if you're looking for a quiet place to study or just to live. His rental policy is great for older students. Also, the customer service is superb.

name: Amanda Weaver-Laird
text:
My experience with Chris as a landlord and Badger Properties has been nothing short of an excellent experience. I moved to Auburn 2.5 years ago for my job in property management and have only lived on properties that I worked at. When I decided to move away from my student housing property I wanted to move somewhere that was close enough to campus that I could walk for game days, but that wasn't full of young students and this was the perfect place (Park Hill cottage). It was secluded and quiet, but just a walk away from downtown and all the fun that Auburn has to offer. The biggest downfall for this property was that there is no dishwasher (not a huge deal), no washer/dryer (but there is a laundry mat on site and down the street at Thatch Hut) and it has cinder block walls so it gets really cold in the winter.

I made the decision a few months ago to move to another newly renovated apartment that Chris also managed (Broadway Apartments) that were a few minutes farther down the road. I was so excited about the price and the location is still great, a littler farther from downtown but the apartment is so worth it! The renovations that Chris did are great, I love the flooring, paint colors, it had new carpeting and the room and closet sizes are great, it also comes with a (very small) dishwasher and a washer/dryer. The only issue that I have with this apartment is the amount of noise that I can hear from the people upstairs. Maybe keep the dogs on the 1st floor! ;-)

Chris has been a great landlord and I would absolutely recommend him to any serious students or young professionals looking to be in a great place in Auburn.

name: ASHLEY MURPHREE
text: Badger Properties is a diamond in the rough when it comes to realty companies in a college town. During my four years at Auburn, I used four different realtors. Badger Properties was by far the best! Chris, the owner, is a very kind and respectful business owner! He does not allow freshmen to lease at any of the properties, which is great for studying. I lived in the complex on W. Glenn, which was great because I was able to walk anywhere that I wanted to go (including class and the library)! You will not regret renting from Badger Properties!

name: Clay Grisetti
text:
If you need a place to stay in the Auburn area contact Badger Properties. Myself, the best man at my wedding, my sister, and many of my friends have been incredibly impressed with Chris Kearns and his locations.

Extremely fast repair or response time if you need anything. Friendly management that does a great job taking the worry out of renting.

If you enjoy Auburn life you can find Chris around campus, town, and even at Sporting Events across state lines.

My wife and our families have moved away from Auburn now but we have recommended Badger to many students and professionals and everyone has the same thoughts: if you need a place to stay, call Chris at Badger Properties.

name: Ashley L.
text: Probably one of the most humiliating rental experiences I've ever had as a renter. I went to Badger Properties because I read good reviews on Google and had heard generally good things from people. I went to the office in person and told Chris "the badger" my situation. I was just getting out of a 12 month rehab program, and had been working for a Christian Ministry and looking for an apartment in Auburn since I was a student at Auburn University at the time. I was very up front about my bad credit but was working 7 days a week and had many references etc to back up that I was honest and good for the rent every month. After seeing me alone in his office after hours, and asking me to come along (still alone) with him to see one of the properties (still after hours) I agreed because I was desperately in need of an apartment. He took me to an apartment to collect rent from a girl around my age, then he took me to another apartment where he basically showed me a place and then just sort of "visited" with some tenants. Every one seemed to like him, the apartments were pretty nice for how old they are, regardless, I was impressed at the time. We then went back to his office (once again, all happening after business hours) and he gave me an application, but before he did that he sat me down in the seating area of his office. We were completely alone and it was very dimly lit, and the front door was locked. He asked me extremely probing and personal questions about my past drug use. Mind you, I was sober for over a year at this point, active in church (still am) and admittedly hadn't even smoked a cigarette in over a year. He asked me questions like, "So what led you to do drugs?" "what kind of drugs have you tried?" "how did you do your drugs? did you shoot up? snort them?" He just kept asking SO many invasive and frankly, inappropriate questions; it was almost sadistic. I answered them as honestly as possible without divulging too much, because I really needed an apartment, I was impressed by the ones he had shown me and I thought that being as honest as I could would show him that I was a good tenant despite my bad credit, etc. After filling out an application and getting my credit checked through the program he said he uses to run credit (which gave a very vague summary of ones credit) I went back to his office once I had submitted my credit report and application. He said he didn't think he could rent to me because my credit report showed that I was $25k in debt; I explained that those were my student loans and that the program he uses wasn't showing exactly WHAT the debt was, just the amount. He said he couldn't rent to someone who was that far in debt. I explained that I am a student and that those are my student loans. I said, I would get a more in depth credit report and bring it to him. He gave me back my money order with the application fee on it and said to come back with a new credit report. My aunt is a real estate agent and she ran my credit for me, this time I had a complete credit report with every single student loan showing in detail, but because I had now ran my credit twice in one week, my already poor credit score was even lower. Despite that I went back to "the badger" and told him that the large amount of "debt" he saw was indeed my student loans, which were not even in collection because I was still attending Auburn at the time. He said then said he couldn't rent to someone with a credit score as low as mine and with a history like mine (due to my past drug use I had a criminal record. I have not had a single run in with the law in almost 4 years). So all in all, after wasting time, money, energy and being thoroughly humiliated, I would say that Badger Properties only serves those they deem worthy, and they don't believe in giving people second chances, only sadistically probing and dissecting the past of people who have made mistakes despite turning their lives around. A huge waste of time.

resp.text:
After 15 years of running Badger Homes and Badger Properties, I stand by my record of treating all applicants fairly in terms of their qualifications for an apartment.  They area 1) Credit score, from a tenant or direct relative, 2) Academic progress, and 3) good references from their previous landlord.  As stated above, our screening reports DO only show a credit score, they do not show a full report - meaning, we don't know the type of debt.  Our screening criteria is designed to approve or deny based on the SCORE, regardless of the type of debt.

If this dispute ever got serious, *I could produce a chain of emails which would explain and clearly show the reason for Denial*.  There was never any "trade" or "back door" approval process offered, and their never has been since I started the business.  We document every case of approval or denial, so we are ready to defend against accusations such as these.  That is not how we operate.  To have one negative review in 15 years should be evidence of how we do things.  Are we perfect?  No.  But we don't run the kind of business we are being accused of in the allegations above.

On the rehab comment: I can confidently say that we have rented to people coming from / still in rehab programs.  We have also rented to gay, straight, and many different religions and ethnic backgrounds, as well as singles, married couples, singles with kids, and families.  We have rented to people with low credit scores, also, but they must have a direct relative with a qualifying score be screened and sign as a Guarantor for their lease.  Our records are clear on that as well.  The "second score" that was brought to me to qualify was well below our minimum qualification.  We require a 650, the score presented was well below 600.

As stated above, there was not a qualifying score, and possibly not the required academic progress - but maybe
she met that qualification, I honestly do not recall.  We do not search any Applicant's criminal record, only our employees.

As stated above, I DID refund the Application Fee, and provide a true explanation of the reason for denial.  I do not remember asking questions about shooting or snorting drugs - I don't even know enough about drugs to know what that would mean anyway.  I have never even had a beer in my life, which everyone I've known for 41 years can verify.

After hours, most (not all) of the lights are off in our storefront office, and the door is usually locked, but it is a full glass storefront on a busy street full of shoppers - so hardly a threatening or scary place.  I admit I probably asked questions that I didn't officially need to ask, true.  I am sorry if doing so had a worse impact than I expected.

I do remember that the reviewer above and I did go to see an apartment and collect rent from a neighbor, but in most cases our rent is paid online, and has been for years.  I always thought that giving tours after hours and visiting with tenants after hours was a sign of good customer service, not something I would have to defend later.

If an independent auditor surveyed all of our current and previous tenants - male and female - over the last 15 years, they would come up with a conclusion that we are a little slow on maintenance, tough on noise, but that's about it.  If they surveyed everyone that has applied and that we have turned down over the last 15 years, they would find that there was a clear reason for each denial, and it was based on our written requirements of Credit Score, Academic Progress, and References.  That's it.  There is no evil, juicy story to report.

Ashley applied to rent from Badger in Sept 2014 for a Dec 14 opening..  I admit, I could have done better with the questions or the office lighting(?), but I have made no further attempt to contact her or to be in her life in any way beyond the Application period.  I am not sure why in April of 2016 she has decided to bring these accusations/allegations.

name: Jackson Hawley
text: We LOVED our time in this property (Sunrise Village unit 110) in Gulf Shores! Just literally steps away from the sand and toes in the water. Our unit was ready to check in before our arrival time! We will never stay anywhere else while in Gulf Shores.

name: Dusti Baldridge
text:
We have had one of the condos reserved for over a year it was recently bought by this company. We were told they would
Honor our reservation, when we called to Secure it we were then told it is now 3700 and not the price we paid over a year ago. They changed the amount of people allowed to stay which is less then what we have and the guy was very rude. Mind you this was done 25 days before we are to be leaving for vacation. There is nothing available now for anywhere close to what we paid and they had no try to help resolve except pay the price that is way more then what we had it booked and paid for it.This is horrible business to basically throw someone’s whole vacation out the window 25 days before they are to leave and not try to honor or work with the customer.

resp.text: Please disregard this review, as this is not a guest or a renter of ours.  We do not buy condos, nor do we own any unit referenced.  The condo was purchased by an individual and anyone can rent it. The buyer instructed us to rent it at market rates and not permit substantial overloading, which is their right and we cannot tell the owner what to do.  This person called and berated our employee who was following the new owner's instructions.

name: Kim Cole
text: My family and I stayed in Shoalwater 1106 in July 2020.  The check-in & out process was easy, and the staff was always friendly.  The condo was roomy and well stocked. We really enjoyed the 3 bathrooms and the roominess of the condo.  We are looking forward to staying there again this year!

name: Nikki Costelloe
text:
Great location. Balcony is over the Holiday Inn pool so there is noise from that. However, likely always over a pool when on the beach. The only difference with the Holiday Inn pool is they alway have water splaying into the pool so there is always a spray noise. This is very minor but could be an annoyance by some.
Very well stocked!! Always had the dish or utensil we needed. Beautiful view with the windows on both the back and side! Would stay here again.

name: Joe Doyle
text:
Broken washer, dirty water, cockroaches, and terrible customer service.

I'll start by saying Gulfsands Rentals offered to compensate me $30 for my trouble, but in my mind is totally unacceptable for the situation. I requested 1 night be reimbursed out of the 7 that we stayed - then after two more emails they never responded.  And apparently this is regarded as a threat by them.

We arrived and the first thing we noticed is the washer door is open and about 1 foot full of filthy dark brown water. We called and got somebody trying to fix it but was unsuccessful. Repair man was great but stated they have been unable to fix washer over past weeks. I left to go to the beach and let him do his work. After 2 days of not hearing anything back I had to call office and ask about what they were going to do about the water. Somebody came to drain it. After a couple more days of not hearing about repair status I asked and they said it's unfixable.

The troublesome part about the washer is they knew it was having issues for weeks and never notified us we would be unable to do laundry. A family of 4 on a beach vacation needs this. I would have found another option. The attitude was consistently like we were a burden and it's no big deal to not have a washer. I'm on vacation and last thing I want to do is spend hours at the laundromat - but apparently that's only worth $30 of trouble.

Additionally there was never anything in the ad about the washer being broken.  Only after my numerous complaints did Gulfsands update their descriptions to say washer did not work.  If you look at other reviews online apparently this has been an issue for months.

Also we found two huge dead cockroaches each about 2.5 inches long. I guess this was the result of the exterminators that arrived unannounced to apply poison in our condo. Between the washer and the exterminator we had 3 visits from maintenance personnel while we are trying to relax on vacation.

Also 2 of the 3 TVs were unable to connect to the Wi-Fi. Not a big deal on beach vacation but worth mentioning. Cable doesn't work in 1 bedroom too.

Also even though Covid restrictions are lifted, Gulfsands is still doing a "remote" check in that is cumbersome. It feels like they are using the situation as an excuse to not have to interact with people. The office you pick your keys up at resembles a maximum security prison with all the cameras and just seems over the top.

Positives were tons of hot water, good location across from Waves (groceries, beer, ice, fishing, etc), and normally an OK value if these problems would have been resolved. Condo is certainly dated.

Overall I can't recommend based on my experiences with how the company is managed and the troubles I described with the condo.

*Update*  I think all you need to do is read the response from the owner below to validate they are unreasonable and probably not worth your business :)

resp.text: Please disregard this review.  This was a guest who threatened us with reviews if we did not pay them a free night for their washer being out of service.  This is a $30 credit item, which is the highest to any guest, as most were $10.  This is for groups of 6.  The guest told staff to 'keep it', as we learned after departure that they wanted more than $200.  This is called post exit rental extortion and is common in the market, especially this year.  We did confirm with the guest that if we didn't pay that amount, he would go on web sites to write negative reviews?  As you can see, this is the result.  The other issues appeared only after the request for money, which is also how this game works.  We don't play, as most other agents have stopped as well.  BTW, a large bug as described is a palmetto bug, and it is not from the condo, as it simply walked in an open door to escape the heat.  That's where they come from, outside.  We wish the guest the best, and hope they enjoy our beaches another time.  The water in the washer was soapy, and emptied as soon as requested, as we had to purchase a pump.  We also treated unit with bleach so it smelled clean.  Pest control comes once every 90 days, and not to poison their condo, but to treat pests, as with every condo in the city.  The new washer was on order, and was noted as not functioning in the rental ad since March 2021.  A new timer was installed for the prior guest to gain some life from the unit, and the unit was working for them, then failed again, as we waited several weeks for the new washer to arrive, which it since has.  Stack units were in high demand due to damages from Hurricane Sally and new construction, so they were not available from any source.  We had to wait weeks for it, but compensated each guest fairly.  This is a review done to intentionally hurt us for non payment of an amount that was not going to happen.

name: Cindy Pinson
text: Stayed here for a week in August and it was fantastic. Place was clean, roomy and had all the comforts of home. More than enough cookware for any kind of cooking you want to do (even a big pot for making a seafood boil). Great beach access and a nice grill. Everything was as described and the books and puzzles were a really nice touch! Communication was perfect from start to finish. Will definitely stay here on any future trips to Gulf Shores. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

name: Emily White
text: We had a great stay!  Communication and booking with Gulfsands Rentals was super easy.  Emails detailed everything we need to know and bring with us.  Check in and out was easy and simple.  Unit 503 was very clean, had new and stylish furnishings, and was very spacious for our family.  Definitely recommend and will still again.

name: Cheri Rash
text: I made reservations for October 22-25, we got there and got our things unpacked. I received a phone call that my mother had passed away and I had to leave the same day. I asked about rescheduling and they will only reschedule for this year even though my work will not let me off during November and December as I work retail. Will not give a refund and I can’t let someone else go in my place. I would think under the circumstances they would work with me because I would love to go back. But definitely do not recommend this company with this kind of service.

name: Hollie Bright
text: We stayed at harbor house B17 everything was great! But the master king size bed needs a new mattress! There is a big dip in the bottom of it which doesn’t make for a good nights rest! Other than that we will definitely stay again!

name: Susan White
text: We stayed at the Blue Atlantis in Gulf Shores July 4-11.  This beach house was perfect for our family.  We loved the kitchen!  There was a problem with a sanitation concern, but it was taken care of a day later.  The beach was wonderful with just a few people from the row of homes...like having a private beach.   The upstairs media room was occupied every day.  If you have a large family of adults and children, you need to check out this home.

name: Michele Kuntz
text: We have used Gulf Sands for 5 years and we are getting ready to book our next vacation. They took care of us each time we had questions or concerns and went above and beyond. As long as well keep coming we will use them to book.

resp.text: Michele, thank you for your kind words and for your continued, repeat business.  -Gulfsands Rentals Team

name: Jeremy Chrastina
text: We have stayed at Southern Sands multiple times over the past few years.  We love the accessibility to everything and the smaller feel of the building.  Very easy in and out of the parking garage as well as the units.  Beachfront is a huge plus.  Walk right out into the beach.  Great views of the coast and sunsets. We tried out a different spot last year and the whole time we were all saying how we wished we had booked at Southern Sands.  We are heading back to Southern Sands this year for sure.

name: Michael Durio
text: We loved our stay for the Labor Day Holiday everything was just as they said it would be.  The condo was well stocked with the essentials, great location and the beach was not to crowded even though it was a holiday weekend.

name: Dianne Epperson
text: Castaways 9C was a good place to stay. Very clean.  Beds were very comfortable.  Only problem was the parking spaces were way to small.  Everything else was just fine.

name: Darci Reeves
text: Stayed at Sunrise Village RM 104 and it was comfortable.  Could use some updating on the mattress but besides that it was fine. 3rd time to stay at Sunrise Village and love the location! Will be back!

name: Kelly Bordelon
text: We stayed at Sunrise village 103 and we were very pleased with our stay. 3 adult and 3 children and it was the PERFECT location right on the beach. It was so convenient here for carrying things on the beach and as well as the store right across the street. The only thing to note would be the screen on the window in the bedroom by the kitchen was ripped off and in that same room there were clothes tags behind the nightstand and a hanger that i seen when inspecting the room (i once was a hotel manager with superb inspecting skills lol). Evidence of previous guest was a bummer but not a big issue since it was just clothes tags because everything else was clean and wonderful. I hope they continue to keep this property up it is way too convenient and we will be back!! The kids loved it here as well! Thanks for an amazing last minute stay!

name: David Mcelhaney
text: This was the perfect location for a family getaway.  The townhouse is directly on the beach which is nice considering it's surrounded by highrises.  Being on the beach allowed for us to come and go as we pleased without having the hassle of going up and down flights of stairs or elevators.  We had 8 in our party and we were all comfortable the entire time with plenty of room to spread out.  We have already recommended to other family and friends and will be back the next time we come to Gulf Shores.

name: Rebecca Payne Rodriguez
text: We stayed at Seaside 3104 and was very pleased. We have stayed at the same place for the last 10 years. Different condos within the same building. You just can’t beat the location. The  building has great parking, sometimes right up to your door. The condo is on the ground floor so no elevators to deal with. Pool is just a few feet away. The master mattress needs to be changed out as it lumpy and hard to sleep on. Floors could have been cleaner upon arrival and there was a dead cockroach on the kitchen floor upon arrival when it should have been just cleaned. Nothing to ruin or stay but those two things need to be addressed.

name: Jeffrey Geddes
text: Excellent service. Loved our stay in Gulf Shores. Very responsive and helpful office. Highly recommended! We love this location as it is more family friendly than other locations appear to be. Being right on the beach at Sunchase was incredible.

resp.text: Thanks so much and we look forward to your next trip!

name: sally randall
text: loved how responsive and helpful they were . Made us feel like they really wanted us to be happy . Nice to feel that way. Very personable and we were not expecting that - as busy as we know they were and are. Really nice people .

name: Cindy Green
text: Harbor House sits on the beach and was wonderful for our stay. The condo itself was a little small but we stayed on the beach all day. It was a wonderful get away!

name: Brandy warden
text: Stayed at the hangout B duplex! Awesome view easy access to the beach and walking distance to the hangout and several shopping places! Customer Service for GulfSand rentals was also excellent they answered all my questions and was very patient. I will be booking again with them when we go back to Gulf Shores.

name: Randi Cialdella
text: Great beach access!  Kitchen updates were beautiful!  Had a little bit of a bathroom issue, and maintenance was quick to respond.  We will be back!

name: Charlene Naramore
text: Absolutely loved everything about our stay.  Gulfsands Rental had contactless service which went perfect.  Our condo was so clean and we will be using Gulfsands again for our future stay!

name: Brooke Walkup
text: This rental company was very unresponsive to my needs. I did not receive  the codes I needed to get into the condo on time. The after hours gentleman on the phone was the only helpful person I ever spoke with. Then once we were finally in; the A/C unit was not working. We spent the first night with NO A/C.  We called for someone to come out that night, but no one ever showed up. I had to call again the next day, then they sent someone out to take care of the problem. I was never compensated or even given a phone call to make sure everything was ok. I even e-mailed them once we were home, they have not responded. Overall this company was very poor! If I owned a condo I would NOT use them as a rental company!

resp.text: Regrettably, we have no one with this name on file.  All check ins receive their box codes as soon as their unit is ready, via email, contactless check in with Covid mandates.  All guests receive detailed instructions the day prior to check in, so they are always on the lookout for the check in email.  We be sure to prepare all guests well in advance due to required state mandates currently in place.  We hope you visit our beaches again and wish you the best.

name: Ginny Duren
text: This was our 4th stay at Southern Sands 305 and it was great as always. Favorite thing about this condo is the balcony. It's huge! We love staying here!

name: Dianne Joy
text: The keyless entry! It’s a must!!! The last thing you want to have to carry with you to the beach is keys.... thank you for having a keyless entry!! The room was spacious and clean and the beds very comfortable! we had an issue with a toilet but we were taken care of immediately! Thank you!!

name: Kevin Green
text: We stayed at Royal Palms next to the state park. Customer service was great! Very prompt response and courteous on the phone. The day we arrived we did a walk through and noticed hair on the floor in the bathroom inside the master bedroom, and there was a strong odor of urine. After raising the toilet seat cover we noticed there was urine on the seat, the rim, and the back of the toilet. We went to the store and bought some cleaner to clean up the mess but could not get the urine smell to dissipate so we closed the door and only used the hall bathroom. It seemed the previous renters had left various children's toys and McDonalds cups in the condo as well. While this wasn't really an issue it made for a disorganized appearance. The A/C was cold, the water was hot, and the view was perfect. I believe your cleaning contractor leaves a lot to be desired and could do a much better job. Knowing that you have various people renting, as a condo owner I would suggest purchasing matching dinner and flatware as well as all cookware. While the appliances were all in working order the dishwasher and washer/dryer were very dated and the stove elements were crooked and awkward to cook on. We absolutely loved the leather/vinyl couch and strongly recommend getting away from fabric furniture unless it is professionally cleaned. I understand the costs of owning beachfront property to be quite expensive, but for the price it could use some updating. You could utilize the cleaning company to check inventory of everything on the day of checkout and charge the renter for anything missing or broken items. Also I strongly encourage you to purchase darkout curtains for the master bedroom as the outside lights and early sunrise made it very cumbersome to sleep. The only reason this got 4 stars was due to the nastiness of the room. We would definitely give this company and owner another chance in the future because we love Gulf Shores and it is our favorite vacation destination so we will be back.

name: Jennifer Boudreaux
text: Very nice place.. comfy beds and convenient location! We will be back. Great value for your money!

name: William Tashie
text: We just finished our 4th year renting at Ocean Reef thru Gulfsands. They always respond quickly and accommodated our request to clean our unti early as we have young kids that nap early in the afternoon. The recent updates to yhe until we're a nice surprise and the new deck was also very nice to have for.our small kids. We will be staying again and hopefully for many years to come. Thanks Gulfsands for accommodating our family!

name: Arnelis Pitre
text: Horrible and rude people to work with. They don't represent the southern hospitality. They don't had any courtesy or consideration to my family. They run their business horribly!! They have a horrible and unsafe "welcome package" set up in where other people can get access to your information. We felt treat by the staff of this place. The people who may recommend  may know them.

resp.text: We always deeply regret any review below 5 stars, and we wish this guest the best for their future.  With the pandemic, our lobby is closed, so we provide detailed check in instructions, and even a laminated sign concealing the check in boxes (so it must be reviewed) reminding guests to only take your package, as there is another one in the same box.  This guest unfortunately took their check in package, and another guest's check in package, so they had 2.  The guest called and told us they had another package, and we needed them to  return the package for the other guest.  This is when the guest became upset with us and did not wish to return it.  The guest did return the package later. The guest then called indicating they could not get into the condo, and became more upset.  The guests were at the wrong door (they were at the unit storage locker).  We got them to the right spot once we figured out where they were.  We do regret this, but during COVID-19, our lobby is not open, and we do all we can to show guests what to do, and we will walk you thru any issue with a call, which we did when we understood where they were.   We did nothing wrong except give a super deal on a last minute 2 night stay with 15% off on top, and an Early Check-In too!  We only wish the guest had taken only their package, as we know this is what created the tension.  Our check in process is very safe, as we've been using it for 25 years without issue.  No one has access to any info about another guest, except their name if they happen to take that guest's package, as the check in boxes are combination locked, and only the guest has the combination.  There is no personal info in any check in package, other than name.

name: Jason Busby
text: We stayed at  Harbor House B20 and could not have been more pleased. Location was great. The condo was very clean and up to date. You cannot beat the beach access, just a short walk across the parking lot. Parking was very convenient. There is a small store directly across the road from the condos. I highly suggest paying just a little more and go there instead of trying to fight the crowd at Walmart!! My family and I will definitely stay here again.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at Harbor House B20!  Thank you for your feedback.  We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

name: Chip Gebert
text: Great people to deal with! Stayed with them before and will stay with them in the future!

name: Dustin Davis
text: Stayed at Crystal Shores West 905. This agency made booking, paying, and checking in so easy and accommodating. Couldnt have worked out any better and been any easier. Thank you. Although we had to cut our trip a day short for family reasons, this particular condo and location were perfect for us. Zero complaints.

name: Carson Dabbs
text: We stayed at Gulfside Townhomes 13. The unit was great and we had no complaints at all. I would like to say thank you to the staff at Gulfsands for making our family vacation so great! The entire process was wonderful from booking to checkout. You won't go wrong if you plan your vacation through Gulfsands!

name: Rachael Myers
text: I am the Kennel Manager for the Baldwin County Humane Society(BARC) and Gulf Sands made a HUGE, very much appreciated donation today of many supplies we desperately needed. They are a wholesome, local company that has our utmost gratitude. Thank You Gulf Sands!

name: Dayvault Robert
text: Stayed at Sunrise Village unit 110. Carpet dirty, no ones vacuumed under beds or under furniture in who knows. Mold on shower curtain. No hangers for clothes. Huge gap under door lets in everything including the cockroaches we killed in the kitchen. Everything worked thank God. Cold A/C, hot water adequate. Lack of kitchen utensils was a challenge cooking. The major thing was I think I paid for a pool and I just couldn't find it anywhere? So it's buyer beware, location is the only thing that saves this place. Even that won't bring me back there other properties close by just as cheap and nicer, I looked.

resp.text: We always appreciate guests taking the time to write comments, but we'd ask readers to please discount this review.  This guest was occupying the unit (mid stay) when he posted this review and never contacted us about any issue.  We emailed, called, and left VM to instruct guest where the pool is located and help to improve his stay.  We dispatched maintenance to address any issues and to show the guest the pool location; however, he was told to leave..but we did provide more hangers to add to those already there.  We honestly don't know if he found the pool, but it's on the north side of the complex in the fenced pool area.  This unit is booked solid, with no open in-season dates due to extreme popularity, and great reviews for value and location.  We tried hard here to assist with any issue.  The bedrooms are very small in Sunrise, so a standard vacuum will not fit under beds there, just a broom, and if any items were missed from prior guest, we'd always address an issue immediately, but we called off the housekeeping crew after maintenance was shown the door.  After the guest departed, we reviewed for issues, found standard pots/pans for cooking, and did address a gap under the front door with a custom door sweep.

name: Ellie Kelsey
text: I have used gulfsands rentals for about 6 Years now and have absolutely loved our stays. We’ve stayed at a few. The staff is great and we look forward to every year... sincerely, the Kelsey’s

name: Drew Deshotels
text: Everything was great, we really enjoyed our visit and the staff at Gulf Sands we're very helpful and efficient. Checking in and out couldn't have been easier. Thanks for a wonderful visit, can't wait to come back!

name: Ronald Woods
text: Found a huge cockroach in the bathroom. I killed it and took a picture, called the office. (Unit- Ocean Reef 702) Explained that this was unacceptable and I would be leaving with my family because of this. Lady said it was “just a bug.” Refused to give any type of refund. This was day 1 of a 4 day stay. Also very musty in the unit, floors were super dirty. When I walked across with my bare feet they were super dirty from the buildup.

resp.text: Hi, we did investigate and noted to the guest we'd be back to them, but they filed this regardless, after noting they'd leave a terrible review if we did not give them money.  As expected, the critter was a palmetto bug, and it likely walked in from an open door, not an issue anyone could correct or anticipate.  It was in the front closet by the main door, and not the bathroom. This is common during our heat wave, as these are large bugs trying to get into the cool unit from an open door, as they hang out by the beach.  No issues of cleaning were mentioned. We will always address any issue for any guest at any time, but we weren't notified of anything until after the guest had left the following day.  No issues were found with the unit, and the palmetto was simply removed.  Renovated, popular, 5-star gulf front townhome.

name: Andrew More
text: I've worked with Gulfsands Rentals since May 2009 and I've been very pleased with the quality of service provided. They are a full-service rental company, trust worthy, and I highly recommend them. My experience was consistently strong rents year-over-year and good communication regarding maintenance items. Great team to work with.

name: rachel saunders
text: The room and accommodations were good for the price, but the cleanliness left something to be desired. The place hadn't been dusted in a long time, the walls had dirt and grime on them, the window glass was dirty, there were dirty dishes in the cupboard upon arrival. I would have loved it if It would have just been clean. I left information for the manager detailing these concerns when I turned my key in. As well priced and convenient as it was,I doubt we will return.

name: DeShunta Wright-Fields
text: My family and I visit Gulf Shores every six months because we love Gulf Shores so much and every visit we use Gulf Sands Rentals. In fact, my husband and I celebrate our wedding anniversary here every year. We have never had any problems with this company. In fact, we love them! We won't rent from any place else. Stephanie is always so accommodating. Her customer service skills are exemplary! We've stayed in a few of their units at Island Sunrise and we completely satisfied. I'm not sure where all the bad reviews are coming from but I can't agree with any of them. My husband and I are visiting Gulf Shores in two weeks for my husband's birthday and our 5th wedding anniversary, we hope this trip is as good as our previous trips! Thank Gulf Sands Rentals for always making our trips to Gulf Shores so relaxing and worry-free!

name: Kathryn Williams
text: What A Scam!! We traveled from the great Northwest to Gulf Shores for the first time. We booked a "condo" in February based on photos on the internet. We were not allowed to see the property until this despicable "businessman" had all our money which was a total of $920. The place was a complete dump! The railing was falling apart. The steps were very dangerous and there was trash around the property. The unit was old and rundown with old furniture and a strange smell. When we rejected the reservation we were told that we would not be getting a refund. What a scam! So, we spent $920 for nothing!! What a rotten way to run a business. I don't know how you sleep at night!  We moved on to a clean, well-kept hotel room right on the beach. You have ruined a beautiful place for us.  We will be telling everyone we know of our experience. "What goes around comes around". You will "get yours" one of these days. Scumbag!

resp.text: We have over 15,000 guests per year, and in business for 20 yrs.  We had seen any items on this page before, so working to reply.  These guests broke all policy, and apparently departed in the middle of the night, but never spoke to anyone.  They booked many months in advance, and saw this cute, economy property online, the actual unit, long before arrival.  Please note, that if this were true, their credit card company would have quickly refunded them, as we work closely to comply with all credit card policies.  Please see our website for accurate reviews, as we have been in business a very long time. 'A' rating on Better Business Bureau also.  Regrettably, we will work to resolve any issue with any guest.  We never spoke to these people, but they use the Internet in regrettably ways, which has become all to common today.  We wish them well regardless.

name: jason testa
text: Top Notch Service! Made the whole reservation a breeze. Very Pleased with our Selection. We stayed at their beach house "Toto" and I must say the view was absolutely stunning. Just A few steps from the back door and You are in the Sand! Could not be Happier. We will be back this summer! Thank you!

name: Krista Haugland
text: I have stayed at sunrise village 7-8 times over the past 8 years.  I love the location, the area is quite and the rooms are always clean. I feel safe at this location and the beach isn't overly full.

name: Kim Terry
text: The Condo is a little dated and worn but clean and close to the beach.

name: Chris
text: Hung up on me when I called in for the first time. Unbelievable

resp.text: Hi Chris, regrettably we did not hear anyone on the other end of the line.  We repeatedly noted ‘gulfsands’ but heard no reply. Likely a connection issue on your end or ours. Any issue was technical and nothing intentional. These things can happen, but never are we trying to disconnect. Hope to hear back in the future!

name: Rachel Frey
text: We love Sunrise Village! Perfect location right on the beach. We will continue to stay here year after year!

name: Tracey Tracey
text: Just getting back from a most wonderful vacation.  Thank you to Gulfsands Rentals for your beautiful accommodations - everything was perfect!!!  We are already planning our trip next year!

name: Sarah Chenault
text:
I rented from Gulfsands Rentals, condo Royal Palms 1202. Although the accommodations were sufficient, they were not as advertised. To begin, we were under the assumption, based on the listing descriptions, that our condo 1202 was penthouse level. Upon arrival we were the last floor before penthouse, but the view was amazing.

This condo is listed to sleep 6 people. The accommodations read king size bed, sofa sleeper and two bunk beds. Specifications should have said children size bunks. The fold out still had plastic on the mattress and sounded like sleeping in a bag of potato chips.  The couch was more comfortable to sleep on as a sofa.

The first two showers that were taken in the hall bathroom were ice cold, as turning the knob to H made the water remain cold leading us to believe the hot water heater was broken. Upon calling Gulfsands Rental, we were informed that the hot/cold was reversed, meaning H was cold and C was hot. The exact words of the agent were, "Oh, that is reversed, try keeping the knob on cold." There was nothing posted to this affect in the bathroom, even though this as a known issue by the rental company.

In the master bedroom, the ceiling fan was not working. When calling the rental company they stated it worked only with a remote of which there was not one. A maintenance request was put in. When the guy showed up to look at it he said the motor was blown and he would have to either order a new part or a new fan. It was not fixed during our 5 night stay. We called on day one about the fan.

Other minor issues were the floor was not clean when we arrived, the wifi connection was unreliable and when eating, the only place for multiple people to eat was on the balcony, 3 deep on the soft or perched on the most uncomfortable bar stools ever created.

To sum up the review, the rental company should have been more forthcoming about known issues prior to booking. We feel we did not get what we paid for. I

I tried to post this on their website, but all reviews are moderated by them so the likelihood of it being seen on their website is slim to none.

resp.text: We regret this review, as the guest was looking at unit 1306 initially, but that unit was not available...penthouse level 1306...and 1202 was and offered with a link to view this unit.  This unit is not, and has never been noted as penthouse level, this was a guest mistake.  Unit 1202 is one level below the penthouse level and 12th floor is no different otherwise.  Nothing special is available on the penthouse floor.  Bunks are photo'd online and ARE described for children.  Sounds like the stay was very good, but not indicated as such.  The shower is actually correct, but we have found the simplest way to note how it works to the guests that have issues is to say its reversed.  There is an arrow on the rounded side of shower arm pointing to the H and C, but most folks miss it, so they assume the arm is to point to H or C.  We regret the issue, but it's just how it was manufactured.  The stools are brand new and heavy duty.  Don't know what else we can say.  This is a wonderful, updated condo with a great view.  We did report the fan not working to the owner, and he is fedexing his replacement for arrival today, as they are special units.  Light worked, and the AC makes the unit very cold, but one fan did not turn during the stay, and we did everything we could to repair it.  We received a 2 star review.  We view this review as inappropriate, as we have great deals and this is a very nice condo.  We feel reviews like this have no place on the web, but they have become commonplace as people will go out of their way to damage a company's reputation with little issue, but the thousands of happy guest won't take the time to note the great time they had.  We have had 12,000 guests just this season....in 20 years we have 8 posts on google.  We always let the reader decide.

name: Patricia Mcwhorter
text: We have used Gulf Sands for years and have been thoroughly pleased with our experiences!  Great rentals at good prices, friendly/efficient staff, and gorgeous beaches - what more could you want?!?!

resp.text: Hey Patricia! Thank you so much for this amazing review! We appreciate your business and we are so happy to hear that you are enjoying your experiences with us! We look forward to host your next vacation rental! - Gulfsands Team

name: Jim Turner
text: Just left today...awesome weather, great spot.  Had one issue, but they sent someone out fast and all got fixed quick.  Thanks guys...back again next year!!

name: Stacey Morgan
text: The whole process with them was like pulling teeth. We are two families that have booked a vacation together the past 3 years. We have been able to list both families and each pay our own part separately with no issue except for here. They will only let 1 person be on the contract and that is the only person that can pick up the keys. It's really inconvenient and aggravating when we travel in separate vehicles and arrive at different times. I stated such to the guy in the office and his attitude was like those at the DMV "oh well, this is how it is,  you have no choice but to get over it". Again, as an owner of the condo, I would want a different company dealing with my renters.

resp.text: Hi Stacey, thanks for your note.  We regret that our credit card policy created your review, as we hope your vacation was enjoyable and you felt you got a good deal (we have the best agent pricing in that complex).  Our policy is provided up front in our rental agreement and also on our Policies page on our web site to keep folks informed.  Card policies in the accommodations industry continually change and have become quite strict.  We follow all Visa, MC, AMEX and Discover policies as they protect both you and the condo owner.  We did offer the option of sending checks from multiple parties, since we can only accept CC payment from the person signing the agreement, and you did send checks from 2 different parties for payment.  We hope that helped.  With check in, our policy is the same as a hotel, and only the person on the reservation can check in.  We can add an additional tenant prior to check in, but they need to sign an agreement and also have a card on file.  Please know that our goal is to make your stay enjoyable, but we do note our policies up front and have to abide by them.

name: Connie Moody
text: Great,family owned rental company! Best rates in Gulf Shores(compared several others)! Always enjoy our trips of many years,now!

name: Sharon Haugen
text: We have rented from them for 8 years you would think that means something but we were treated very bad this tshaugen@frontiernet.net we have got the problem fixed and we will be renting from them again this year.

resp.text: We regret this review from a customer, but this was simply the guest wishing us to provide free nights for extending their stay, and we offered a 50% off rate, which was super and the guests indicated they would call us back.  When they did, they noted how badly we treated them, did not take the big discount, and left on time.  We regret they didn't wish take the discount, but we did not deserve this review for offering a great deal.

name: Susan Frederick
text: Really pleased with our stay. Our condo was right on the beach, well equipped  and very clean. Helpful staff- seamless service

name: Ashley Marotta
text: Great experience with Gulfsand Rentals! Loved our stay here and the whole process was quick and easy, will totally be back!

name: Trese Mashburn
text:
Regatta 203C -
While we absolutely LOVE this property and this will be our 3rd year in a row to stay in this unit, the reservation process this time was beyond ridiculous. This new management company was difficult to reach, several calls were made to attempt to reserve the unit during "normal business hours", but was met with a message that the office was closed during said hours. We always make this trip with family friends and we split the cost and deposit. This management team made that process nearly impossible and the young lady that I dealt with was rude, kept repeating herself without making herself clear, AND talked over me constantly. The previous management company for this property was friendly, helpful and accomodating with the separate payments - unfortunately this management company was anything but. It should not be this difficult to give a business my money. Still looking forward to our stay however, and will continue to stay in this unit as long as it is available because we love the unit and it's location with proximity to everything.

name: Jim Thompson
text: Great company we've used for years.

name: Sarah Daigle
text: There was absolutely nothing to like about Island Sunrise #556 but the view! This had to be the most disgusting condo I have ever walked into. There were missing and burned out lights throughout the unit. The linens and towels were poorly laundered. Before we could ever eat, we had to wash all of the silverware and dishes. There was hair all over the floors and when we tried to use the vacuum in the unit, all it did was spray sand everywhere and smell like a wet dog. Even the cushions on the couch and chairs felt wet and smelled like mildew. I have spent MANY vacations along the Gulf Coast and this one was truly regrettable. We checked out 2 days early because of the filthy conditions in the condo!

name: perin elliott
text:
First of all, sent payment in the form of a cashier's check, and just because it wasn't a "postal money order" they wouldn't accept it, so I had to go back to my credit union, withdraw another $200 and take cash down there with us and get the cashier's check back from them.  Ridiculous.  Any cashier's check is as good as cash.

Secondly, got to the condo and it was nothing like the photos or as described.  They say in the literature they send you there are "beach balls, beach chairs and umbrella" at the condo.  No such thing.  And no information at the condo on where or how to rent any.  Condo was much smaller than described and much older.  Some of the steps leading up to the second floor were dangerously high and some of the floor on the balcony outside is wet and apparently about to cave in.

First night there my husband needed to work on some homework for school and the internet was down.  Had to wait until the next day, then had to drive to their office to get it fixed - this after several calls to customer support.

Remote to main t.v. is broken.  They have a bad ant problem in the kitchen.  They give you NO extra towels or garbage liners.

We were VERY disappointed in this place and will NOT be using them again.

resp.text: We regret our guest would post this review, as the information noted is simply not accurate, and the guest never complained about any issued presented, with the exception of an Internet log in issue, which we helped to resolve with the utility provider.  To note each: payment submitted was not a cashiers check, which we did our best to accurately note to the guest. All payment options are sent to guests at time of booking.  A bank check is not certified funds, as this was not a cashier's check.  Beach balls are not in any unit, and no such items are noted in any information we provide.  Beach chair/umbrella rental info is provided with check in docs, including cost, vendor name on the beach and phone number for contact/reserving. Photos are exactly unit 205 which was completely remodeled from scratch...100% new interior rebuilt in February 2015, including all cabinets, interior doors..everything in the unit, except the shower stall.   Remote works fine, and no issue reported.  We provide 6 towels and a washer/dryer.  Condo is advertised as 600 sq ft, and it is just that also. We provide every guest with 'Things to Remember to Bring' and tell them at the time of booking. No ants were reported and nothing was found.  Guest WALKED into our office, to report Internet issues, which is provided by a 3rd party utility, and we called for them and appear to have gotten login issue resolved.   None of the items above were reported at that time or at anytime until now. This review should not be posted, as this is an extremely popular condo, and the guest appears to be confusing someone else's ad or info with this unit.  We honestly don't know how to reply to this...as its simply wrong.  We believe this guest was venting at us since we did not accept their payment.  No other issues were noted at any time.  Stairs are common size, so not sure how to reply there, and no items at all are about to cave in, and the facility had just received brand new aluminum railings too.

name: William Louis Humston III
text: Wonderful place

name: Monica Townsend
text: Great place to stay.

name: Rhonda Bensen
text: A beautiful place with the best view.

name: Richard Soest
text: The older white security guard lied to us about the parking.they give you 2 parking passes but we had 11 people 4 cars had to park 2 at Walmart we won't be back.the younger black man was very nice and polite

name: Jody Arnold
text: Clean! Exquisite! Have ALREADY started recommending to friends.

name: Paul Plumlee
text: PH17 has 3700 sq ft and takes up the entire 17 floor. You have access to beach and lagoon with private pier on lagoon to dock your boat. Your only minutes from all the restaurants and the best part is it's not over crowded. Hard to believe you can spend time on the beach during peak season and not having people camped out right next to you. As for beach life this is the best place I have ever stayed at plus it feels like home and not an apartment. Absolutely love this unit❤️

name: Merideth Langley
text: Our 10 person group loved our stay here! Right between the bay and the ocean, you have a great view 360. We stayed in the penthouse and spent a lot of our time playing pool and games provided. There are lots of great seafood restaurants nearby as well as fun activities both indoor and out. This is a great place to stay (any time of year) without the overcrowding of some other beach towns.
