name: Danette Kirvin
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Lagoon Tower.  Our condo was just what we needed to relax with an awesome view of the lagoon. The beach is within walking distance. We are planning our family vacation for the same condo next year. We booked at the last minute through Meyerre because they offered the vacation protection insurance.  We were traveling with our  elderly mother and we needed the protection.  She enjoyed sitting on the balcony gazing at the water, watching the boats and the children play in the water. The facility was clean.  The location is great because it is close enough to travel to main events, but far enough from the crowded beach areas.  There are indoor and outdoor pools, and two grills on the deck.

name: Eriq Blanchard
text: Took a family vacation to Lagoon Tower recently. The place was absolutely beautiful, and the beach view is awesome if your condo is facing the beach. However, when we checked in they only gave us two parking passes for the parking lot, when we should have gotten three. You get one parking pass per bedroom in your condo. That part wasn't bad. What discouraged me the most about this condo was several of my family members were sitting outside on the balcony one night, and I was in the living room. I heard a knock at the door, and the security guard informed me that we had received a noise complaint. Note, I did not hear them talking, and I was less than 20 feet away from them inside. We give that the benefit of the doubt, the next situation was too much. We were enjoying a barbecue with the family listening to clean country music, at 7PM. It was still daylight outside. The security guard again told us that we were being too loud. This frustrated the group due to the time of day. Lastly we observed the owner of the place who actually lives there walking in the parking lot pulling on car doors. Even pulling on one of the family members that was staying with us car door. The security guard informed us that it was the property owner calling in all of the complaints, and eve threatened the security guards job. I'd be the first to admit if we were out of hand, but everything was minute. I typically do not write reviews but this was completely necessary.

name: OhSo BreDee
text: Gulf Shores, Alabama is such a beautiful location. This is one of many beautiful places to rest while you're between the beach and lagoon.

name: James McCrary
text: Well Kept, quality Facility,  Access is a bit quirky, but good overall.

name: Jay Stainbrook
text: Great views!

name: Chris Aplin
text: Very nice so far.

name: Sherry Hoelting
text: Great plave to stay all the amenities

name: Brandon “Tinkerbell” Whitsett
text: Beautiful area, nice people, friendly guest

name: Jay Grant
text: Everything was awesome!

name: Dina Barrett Grantham
text: Amazing place!

name: Brad Ramsey
text: One of the best neighborhoods near 280 you can find.  It's actually pretty funny that 15 people here gave this community a 1 star review because some guy couldn't keep up with his dog (cancel culture I guess).  I don't think any of them actually live there.  New HOA is doing a great job of maintaining the community areas.  If you work near 280 you won't find a better place.  It's very quiet and safe.

name: Jana Maynard
text:
If you’re looking for a great place to live and have pets, this is NOT it! A friends dog went missing and the people who run this place have been nothing short of rude, inconsiderate, and anything but helpful.
Instead of offering to help and be kind an supportive, they have been rude to the entire family.
I would NEVER recommend living here.  Anyplace that is so rude and unkind is not worth it.  Don’t give them your money....especially if you have pets.

name: Villeta Pinson
text: Moving back to Birmingham and I was looking at apartments and saw a review on this place.I guess I won't be checking here because I definitely need a pet-friendly place even if I only have one pet I need to know that they would be nice to it! Moving on!

name: James Holland
text:
Property management doesn’t care about people or their pups. Luna recently went missing in the area and the property management had the nerve to call Madi (the owner) and tell her the missing dog signs were “littering”. They have all since been taken down.

The only trash in the area is the mental state of condo management who takes down lost dog posters.

name: Brittney Simonson
text: The manager of this property is a miserable human being. A friend of mine's dog recently escaped and she left lost dog flyers around the complex since the dog was seen around there. He had the nerve to call her and tell her she was littering and took down all of the signs. It's a shame to see someone so uncaring about his community to be in charge of an establishment - From previous reviews it looks like he's not doing that great of a job anyways.

name: Emma Tillery
text: I’ve lived here for 4 months now and I’m not able to get a mailbox key, pool key, or gym key because the office has been closed since I moved in. The number that is posted on the office door always goes straight to voicemail. I have no way of getting my mail, which is obviously an issue because I have bills and packages just sitting in the mailbox. I’d like to take advantage of the pool, since it finally just opened but I have no way of getting in. I’m paying high dollar for my condo, and I feel like I should have the ability to take advantage of the amenities. There was a sign outside that said the office will now be open on Thursdays and Fridays, so I went to the office on Friday and was greeted by a security guard that said he had no idea what I was talking about, and that I was the 5th person that day asking about the office being open. So I know I’m not the only person here dealing with these issues. On the bright side, grounds seem to be well maintained. My building was just re-roofed and pine straw was laid outside.

name: Dez Johnson
text: This place is awful. The grounds are terrible and the railings on each unit need repairing. Finally got pool done after 2 years. Parking is awful. Very unpleasant atmosphere to be on 280. This is a subpar apartment complex at best. Don’t move here people don’t clean. Up after their dogs. This place is a joke management taking HOA dues. The entire place needs a complete make over.

name: Holly Clark
text: Management at this facility called a dog owner accusing her of littering for posting a lost dog poster and proceeded to throw away every sign. This is absolutely disgusting. Do not live here if you want management who cares about your family, your pets, or your happiness in general. If I could give it 0 stars I would.

name: Rheagan Courville
text: Wish I could give this less stars

name: Shelly Ridlehoover
text: It's home. Despite some issues, it's home

name: Brittany Burney
text: These are the best apartments I’ve ever lived in! The grounds are quite and nice. The apartments themselves have a very welcoming and homey feel and the staff is amazing! Everyone is so friendly and easy to communicate with. I highly recommend it here.

name: Teresa “Dee” Collier
text: I really enjoy my apartment. Everyone seems to be really nice. All the office staff are always so helpful and polite. This has been a great place to live.

name: Ami Taylor
text: We absolutely love our apartment. We have brand new appliances and carpet. The closets are huge and so are the rooms. I can’t say enough good about the staff. They’re attentive and so kind. My only complaint is that I didn’t move in here a long time ago!

resp.text: Thank you,  we are so happy to hear that!

name: Mindy Stoneburner
text: ABSOLUTLEY a beautiful complex , & wonderful management & super friendly staff.

name: Seokwon Lee
text: Where to start... first off the pictures that are posted Is definitely not what you see! They lie about your monthly rate just to wheel you in and charge you way more, they say water, pest control is included in your rent and that’s a lie!! The apartments are infested with gnats and roaches!!! Maintenance is sorry and never fixes NOTHING!!! they are always outside of the units smoking and hanging out not a good look at all!! Apartments floods, issue is never fixed! Front office staff lies. This is been the worse experience ever!!! I wouldn’t recommend this place to a homeless person

resp.text: While we always like to hear from our residents, we’re sorry to see that your experience does not reflect the high standard of living we strive to provide. We sincerely apologize that your experience with us was not a positive one. We are always open to opportunities to improve our service and welcome you to our office to see if we can resolve any outstanding issues you've experienced.

name: Katrina Looney
text: Hello and I would like to say thank you to the office staff of City Heights Homewood for listening, understanding & followup with my work order request.  Thank you to the maintenance crew who are working hard with the workers orders & your understanding.  Thank you again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review! You made our day!

name: George Davis
text: The office staff is superb and nothing short of amazing. THANK YOU MRS. ODOM for all the help you constantly provide. This new system and team give hope to this area community. The best, apartments ever!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review! We will strive to continue with our tradition of high service quality!

name: Noplacelikeths P
text: I would like to say that first off the pictures that you see on the internet are very misleading . Me and my roommate moved in less than 5 weeks ago . There were roaches in the nasty and dirty refrigerator when we first moved in . Around the third week we started to see more and more roaches crawling up the wall , through the kitchen cabinets , under the sink , in the bathroom. And me and my roommate are very clean people so we know that these bugs did not come from us . We even went and bought expensive bug spray that SHOULD prevent bugs from coming in your apartment to you to a year . That doesn’t work ... not to mention the doors are very flimsy , the plumbing is old rusty and dusty . The water goes out almost every week without warning . They add extra fees saying that it’s for cable , and WiFi etc . But when we first moved in those things were “free “ or “included in rent “ . They don’t care about your well being at all , all they care about is getting a check and I really feel played because basically I am paying to live in a dump full of roaches .

resp.text: We are really sorry you had such a negative experience with our property. At City Heights we strive to provide the best service at all times. Could you please reach out to our office so we can understand your issues and sort them out? Thank you!

name: Zoe Duncan
text:
They won't fix a single thing in our apartment, despite several of the maintenance requests being listed as "emergency," such as the constant leak in our ceiling that has been there for over two months now, but they'll spend money on billboards...

Don't live here. Neither you nor laws regarding apartment complexes are their priority here. Their priority is your money.

They will also not disclose that you HAVE to purchase their $75 cable/internet package, which if you have to work from home, you won't be able to because the Wi-Fi is so bad you can barely even stream Netflix on it.

They have changed property managers every 2-4 weeks for the past six months, and maintenance doesn't work at all. They sit outside the office's garage and smoke cigarettes all day, and MAYBE take a joy ride in their little maintenance golf cart.

Don't waste your money. It's Homewood prices for a slumlord complex.

resp.text: Zoe, it is unfortunate to receive a review such as this. We apologize for any issues that you may be experiencing due to unresolved issues prior to our management transition this past August. Upon learning last week of the maintenance problems you'd been having, our management and maintenance team scheduled to visit your home the very next day in order to assess your situation. However, due to the condition of the home upon entering, they were not able to properly provide any resolutions to your requests. We can assure you that your home was securely locked after our exit. We spoke with both you and your husband regarding the condition of your home, and the necessary steps that needed to be completed before we can make any repairs. We want all of our residents to feel comfortable and at ease in their homes, which is why it is imperative that we help rectify this circumstance as soon as we can. We would appreciate the opportunity to address any of your current questions or concerns offline, and encourage you to visit our office or give us a call at your convenience.

name: Dean Winchester
text: WORST MANAGEMENT. WORST SERVICE!!! Your not on a water bill by yourself so you’re paying for other ppl water depends on how many ppl in the building. A high unnecessary bill. My first apartment please do not rent here !!!!! They are nasty and do not care about ppl. Will see you calling and not answer the phone if y’all have encountered problems. Please run!!! You’ll regret it

resp.text: We’re disappointed to see some aspects of life in our community have fallen short of your expectations and we would love the opportunity to improve your experience. Our residents are our number one priority, however, we are sorry if you feel like this has not been the case. Please contact our office so we can discuss your particular concerns further.

name: Cynthia Dugger
text: Andre did. A great job

resp.text: Cynthia, we are happy to hear that! Thanks for the special shout out and we will be sure to pass along your kind words to our team member.

name: Jalen Kelley
text: You can NEVER get anyone on the phone & it takes them a month or two to come out & fix things. I’m very disappointed in them & I haven’t been staying here for a good two months & already ready to MOVE. They are terrible

resp.text: We’re sorry to see your customer service experience has fallen below our high standards of resident care. We’d appreciate another chance to improve upon our communication with you by speaking in person. If you’re willing to try again, we invite you to stop by the office so we may have an opportunity to talk through your concerns.

name: katherine owian
text: Frequent changes in management & management companies do not make for a happy/healthy atmosphere. The owner of the complex in 80's & 90's knew the way to treat people. He had a dynamic office manage. The staff were well treated so they responded with good treatment of tenants. This was a family oriented place to live. In 30 years there have been plenty of changes. A few have been good. But neglect, bug infestation, sloven neighbors make for less desirable conditions. We stay for convenience to UAB Hospitals & doctors. We have reared a family here. We love Homewood & will stay as long as it takes to get medical care.

resp.text: Katherine, we sincerely appreciate our feedback, and we are honored that you and your family have continued to be an amazing part of our community for so long. We can assure you that our current team is dedicated to providing a comfortable, well-maintained environment for all of our residents, and we apologize if you have received the opposite impression. We would love the opportunity to improve your stay with us, so please feel free to reach out to our office directly if you would like to discuss any concerns with our management team. Thank you kindly, and we hope to hear from you again soon.

name: Gwendolyn Brown (Godsgirl)
text:
I visit my daughter often and I must say that although the name of the place has changed, I am VERY disappointed in regards to how maintenance matters are handled.  She has water issue in the ceiling area, someone did respond very quickly, BUT to go in and take HER trash can for it to continue to capture the water and its been sitting there and sitting there. I have already shared with her that it is her private property and the nasty water needs to be caught by a container that the complex owns. Why leave an opening for the possibility of other things to crawl out.
If you are a first time renter, PLEASE DO NOT sign the lease here until you have read the reviews.
Our daughter had been delayed in getting her place because they were cleaning it. Ha! The carpet had not been cleaned, the outlining of the previous person's bed was still visible in the carpet, dead roaches were present, a piece of the carpet was missing, LOT"s of doggie doo was on the balcony area and then some, WE cleaned her apartment.
When the NEW management team was in, I took them pics of EVERY single concerning area only to have been nicely told that I would need to write up each one because of how they do their work orders. I had pics and all and it was nicely done and could have easily been followed.
We are hoping that she can move elsewhere when her lease is up.
I do NOT like visiting, but I do.
They did clean up the trash dumpsters and that helped a good bit.
I would like to encourage tenants to contact their city officials and make written reports if you are not being taken care of. Some people feel as if they have no options, but you do.
I would like to encourage you to start sending certified letters when your matters are not being take care of as well. Make copies of any and all communication between you and the leasing agent.
I have tried to leave matters to my adult daughter, but I am about to have to get involved soon.

resp.text: We truly value your feedback, Gwendolyn, and we sincerely apologize if you and your daughter feel you have not been the high-quality service that we strive to provide. We understand that first impressions are important when moving into a new home, and we are sorry that your daughter's home was not in line with your expectations. We would greatly appreciate an opportunity to work with you to get your stay with us back on track. Please reach out to us as soon as possible so we can discuss resolutions for any outstanding issues that your daughter is encountering.

text: NO WATER FOR THE FIRST 8.5 hours  on our first day. Unit 202  is very run down. In need of maintenance and updating. Peeling cabinets , broken doors and drawers. Dirty carpet, water damage in small bathroom with a musty foul smell. Broken light switch, dirty bathroom floor.  Very little walking room in bedroom. The bed is squeaky. Very noisy from upstairs. Was given a WiFi password but no wifi for our unit.  Definitely not worth the $2100. The pictures on the website are very deceiving. The only positive is the beach view. We worked very hard to save up enough money for a "luxury" stay. This is far from luxury. We could have went to Mexico for an All-inclusive stay for significantly less. I  unable to post all pictures.

The people were nice enough, but when i called to make a complaint i was greeted with attitude that made me want to demand a refund and to find another place but they dont do refunds so i was stuck here. The views and the beach are great. The building itself is very run down.  Probably built in the 70s. Our unit was updated and nice.

The best part is the very short walk to the beach.

name: Shawnda Bickel
text: Had an absolutely great time! Great location, nice beach, friendly people! We will be back!

name: Beverly Bradley
text: Lovely condo. Loved the Florida room!!!

name: Neal Casey
text: It was a very nice place to stay. Had all we needed for our 5 day stay. Look forward to staying there again soon on our next fishing trip!

name: Avery Allen
text: We love it here! The condos are really clean and very beachy and the pool is really nice and rarely ever busy. 2nd floor condos that face W Beach Blvd have a slight ocean view in between the two high-rises. Only a short walk to Pier 33 general store and beach access. Will definitely be back!

name: Samantha Cannon
text: Loved this condo so much! We didn't want to leave.

name: Brenda Carter
text: Second stay and love the location...so close to everything!

name: Rob Kumpf
text: The place is clean and we'll located in relationship to the main roads and one block from beach public parking.  Great view from balcony.

name: Henry Montez
text: Great place with a great view....🌊🌴

name: Julie Antonic
text: Nice, quiet, convenient,  affordable 10/10.  Would recommend!

name: amanda Gregory
text: Great place to stay while visiting gulf shores or orange beach area. Price was very affordable. Laundry area was very nice and affordable. Pools were very well maintained and clean. Walk across the street to the beach. Grilling area if you wanted. Beds were very comfortable. Had everything you needed in the kitchen. Cable supplied through dish network. Very spacious and had a balcony.  Close to all the tourist attractions. This will be the first place I check for future trips. It was perfect for a family getaway.

name: Peggy Delatte
text: Inviting, clean, and convenient to nearby everything

name: Jason Anderson
text: Hello, we are owners of a unit here. It is a nice quiet area, very family oriented. We hope to keep it that way as well. It's sad to see a few reviews of dirty rooms but everyone reading this needs to remember it's not a hotel so each room will depend solely UPON THE OWNER of the unit as to the cleanliness and and the communication and ease of that communication. I will say I visit my condo weekly with kids for polls and cleanup. The community areas are tended daily and the pools are kept clean. From time to time there are guest who leave trash and do not respect others but as owners we do our best to screen each renter as best possible. Overall this CAN BE a very nice place to stay close to all the happening areas as well as short walk to public beach access. Just make sure to book your condo with a RESPECTABLE owner with positive reviews and good feedback. Try AirBNB look for unit 110 ;) .... check reviews. And most of all ENJOY LAS PALMAS no matter what room you stay in and remember to respect others and the condo rules so we can all have a nice place to enjoy the gulf coast.

name: Dustin Roden
text:
Clean pools, clean rooms, of course that part I am sure is depending on the room ;) beach access in front of Pier 33 so just a short walk and also plenty of beach chairs for rent

The building is 3 stories with the bottom being parking. Remember no elevators here so the climb can be brutal but we all need a good walk so it wasn't bad ;)

name: Austin Reach
text: We were asked to leave early because of music being played that we turned off after asked to do so. The managers are disrespectful and do not know how to do business. Not worth the price.

name: Kim Menchaca
text: Nice place to visit

name: Drake Scott
text: I personally don’t recommend this place for anyone below the age of 25 because it’s all older people who stay in their rooms all day and complain when music is being played a little to loud. We was kicked out for playing our music to loud and did not receive this first warning regarding this either. Manager said that we had 30 minutes to get out and we moved everything out and didn’t even get a refund even though we had 1 day left that we rented for. Awful experience overall and seriously don’t recommend this condominium to anyone

name: Kenya Norris
text: We stayed at unit #104! It was decorated with a coastal nautical flare that was adorable! So conventient to the beach with a short walkpath across the street that leads to the boardwalk with outside shower! The two pools were so nice and absolutely beautiful at night. I want to go back!!

name: woolever231
text:
This place is very nice.
We stayed in unit 214. It was just completely remodeled and has a nice view of the ocean from across the street.

name: Dee Pomelow
text:
Rented unit 205 8/31 to 9/9/18. Upon arrival condo was dirty; black mold on central air vents, sticky floors, long black hairs in the shower, could write your name on dust on refrigerator..  disgusting (photos to support claims)
Laundry facility is on the same floor, has no a/c, very hot. Has a camera & a warning under surveillance sign posted. We had 2 loads of laundry stolen from dryer. The only contact
number we could find was in a binder in the condo and it was to the previous property owner. Finally after emIling & calling, the president of the board  called us. When we asked to review camera footage, he told us it's fake,  doesn't work. He never apologized never offered anything to help with the cost of replacement. He said he'd never heard of it happening, may have happened many times, but since theres no numbers posted for assistance, that may be the problem.
I do not suggest this condo, save your money. We stayed at the surf & rachet club last spring in gulf shores with no issues. May cost a little more, but well worth it!

name: Samantha Bateman
text: This place is amazing , so clean and quiet! Family friendly

name: shannon alred

resp.text: Thanks for your fantastic review of Brett/Robinson Vacations, it's providing experiences like the one you've described that keep us excited about what we're doing every day!

name: Mickey Berry
text: We had an amazing time here!  Though the was a tropical storm and it was predicted that we’d have 90% chance of thunderstorms every single day of our trip, only the first day of the trip was stormy.  The building and condo are amazing and the beach is the best ever!  Can’t wait to come back here !

resp.text: We're so happy to hear your vacation was a success Mickey! You know what they say, a rainy day is better at the beach! Thanks for taking time to leave Brett/Robinson a review, and we hope you'll come back and stay with us again!

text: Great location.  Well kept facilities.  Great views from corner unit.  Surface of walkway to beach does not get hot thanks to special decking they installed.  Beach has not been crowded.

resp.text: Brent we are so happy to hear you enjoyed your corner unit and walks to the beach! We sure hope to welcome you back again soon. In the meantime, be well!

text: Quiet/nice guests/nice beach

resp.text: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and appreciate you taking the time to leave us a 5-star rating.

name: Roger Dickey, Jr
text: Beautiful room, great ocean view, very luxurious. Would recommend for anyone looking for a fancy beach getaway.

resp.text: We are excited that you all enjoyed your stay! Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your experience. We hope to welcome you back again soon Roger!

name: Tracy Freeman
text: Love the view and amenities!

resp.text: We're so happy to hear your vacation was a success! Thanks for taking time to leave Brett/Robinson a review, and we hope you'll come back and stay with us again!

name: Drew Brewer
text:
This place may be nice and all and I’m sure your looking through the reviews if this is a good place to stay. First things first go ahead and save yourself from endearing a horrible experience.

I booked this room for my soon to be wife’s company’s brand rep photo shoot. We checked in and we all bought parking passes and everything they required. Got to the room and boom right off the bat the pullout bed was completely broken, the ice make was making loud sounds and did not produce one ice cube, the screen door was hanging by a tread about to fall off the balcony. I messaged them about theses things the day we got here and did not get a reply!

Well things got worse. We had an extra girl coming and she got here a few nights after our first nights stay. She arrived at 1 in the morning the guard waved her through so she parked and slept until they had to be at a photo shoot early in the morning at sea side (3 hours away) well before she got back here car had a boot on it and two tickets. No warnings just two tickets and a boot. Less then 20 hours and boom they hit her with this and a $250 fine. We talked to the mannager the next day and he was rude and could careless. Had the guard been doing his job and actually checked to see if she had a parking pass non of this would of happened!

This entire say was a big bust and couldn’t of gotten any worse!

Find a place that wants you to stay there and that will treat you with respect and not be rude and ruthless about the parking situation I mean I understand why they have to be strict but right now with COVID-19 going on there’s tones of empty parking spots and they were not hurting on parking spots!

Very dissatisfied will not recommend this to anyone. If you stay here your crazy!

resp.text: Drew, we are so sorry to hear about your recent visit. After looking into the situation our management team has determined you did not book through us at Brett/Robinson Vacations as the unit & situation described is not part of our rental program. We agree this sounds like a very frustrating station,  and it is our hope you will consider booking with us at Brett/Robinson in the future. We highly value our guest's choice to vacation with us, and have dedicated staff members in our call center who are here to help you find the best unit on the coast for your specific needs and desires. Please give us a call at 1-800-211-7892.We hope to welcome  you back soon!

name: Steve Neitzel
text: A Great Place to Stay!

resp.text: We are excited that you all enjoyed your stay! Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know about your experience. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

name: Pgr Gr
text: My family stayed here last week. This place is beautiful. My family loved the fact we had so much room & we had our own space & weren't tripping all over one another. All 3 kids had their own bed & bathrooms which is awesome when you have 3 girls. I would definitely recommend this to everyone as long as they don't take our condo 😁😁

resp.text: Thank you so much for leaving a review of your stay. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your time with us and cannot wait until you get to return to the beautiful beaches!

1402

Loved it...wish the Gulf was clearer...Destin again next year!! I miss the blue :)

Loved Loved the Decor and spaciousness in both!!

resp.text: Hamid:  Thank you for this wonderful 5 star review.  We look forward to seeing you again at the beach soon.

name: Penny Ballard
text: Beautiful & Totally peace!

name: Lauren F
text: Fantastic staff!  Priscilla Nguyen is amazing!  Seriously, she is so great y’all!!!  Went above and beyond to help us with our move in and made everything so easy and stress free!  The apartment is great, everything was ready to go for us in an extremely short timeframe.  From the friendly security at the gate to the leasing office staff, we felt immediately at home and welcomed with enthusiasm.  We knew we had made the right choice making Vie at University Downs our new home!

name: Tarraina Turner
text:
I’ve lived here for almost 3 years so since before the transition to new management. Took almost a year to renovate but everything is beautiful. However, the transition to a new wifi had left me unable to work from home or do schoolwork because of the terrible connectivity. I can barely even watch tv on my Xbox since they switched the network. I have called white sky and nothing helps. They installed the wifi in a terrible place so I can’t even connect a router to extend the signal. White sky person came and recommended that I run a cord from the kitchen to the other side of my apartment. Never had these issues when we had Xfinity and it was much nicer. The apartment is overpriced for students not to even have good wifi and there aren’t any Ethernet ports to hardwire internet. It is not a hardware issue. My TVs and Xbox are brand new and I had NO issues with xfinity for the 2 years we used them. As you can see in my pictures sometimes the connection drops just minutes between.

UPDATE: The owner of my condo is now trying to move us out. The office has sent people up here AGAIN to work on the WiFi and they said the issue was not the WiFi but my usage. However, when I had all devices off as they suggested, other than the one I am using, and I’m still unable to work on school or remotely effectively. I try to meet with people in the office, and they treat me with disregard. I have lowered my rating due to the lack of understanding when it comes to the WiFi.

resp.text:
Tarriana,

I am sorry to hear about your issues with our WIFI connectivity.  I have asked our Accounts Manager Tyler Low to look into the situation further and he will be contacting White Sky.  Unfortunately, the switch to White Sky was authorized by the Condo's home owners association and we did not have any control on the switch but we are looking into how we can fix the problem.

Thank you,

Kyle Orabone
Property Manager

name: mclain Beaulieu
text:
I have lived at Vie for around 7 months and I have had nothing but great experiences here. The staff is very friendly and attentive. If you have any issues a quick call to the office will solve it. The complex itself looks great and is very clean. The apartments are spacious and comfortable which make you feel like a king. Amenities are top tier, I myself use the gym a lot and its always kept in perfect condition. If you are a student or local resident Vie should be on the top of your list of places to consider.

- Conrad Beaulieu

resp.text:
Conrad,

Thank you for sharing your comments about living with Vie at University Downs.  We strive to provide an amazing experience for all of our guests and we are very proud of our community.  If you ever need anything be sure to stop by and see me in the office.

Kyle Orabone
Property Manager

name: Penelope Featherington
text: I cannot say enough good things about University Downs! Every single amenity is top notch! The staff in outstanding! There is one guy in particular that stood out the most, Kyle Orabone! HE IS FANSTATIC!!! He made me feel right at home. I would even go as far as saying he is the reason I made University Downs my HOME!!! Don't miss out on this awesome place, or Kyle!

name: Patricia Moore
text: Had a very nice visit. The staff was amazing. They were also very helpful at any questions I had. Management was awesome.

name: Colton Kuykendall
text: I'm loving my experience as a resident of the Downs. Great friendly staff, Nice community, beautiful pools and Clubhouse.

name: Emma Milianta
text: I love living at vie on the apartment side! My boyfriend lives on the condo side and that’s how I found out about vie! I love the amenities and maintenance has been super quick every time I needed them!

name: Sebastian 9
text: Lived here for a year water pressure was terrible, you couldn’t have two water appliances running at the same time or else they wouldn’t work. You have to walk your trash the other end of the apartment complex. Frequently had bugs and the upstairs neighbors stomped all year. And all of this was way overpriced. Just overall not worth what they charge.

name: Brooke Owen
text: Me and my roommate have perviously never lived in apartment before. We had many worries of living on our own for the first time but within the first week of living here, it has been nothing less than perfect. We have never felt unsafe while living here, we don't have any kitchen appliances break down on us and most importantly, if is worth every dime to live here. We have friends in other apartments who feel like they are paying way to much to constantly having their dishwasher break down, or feeling like it is too dangerous to come home after 11pm. My roommate and I both highly recommend living at UDowns. Between the pool when its hot out and the weekly giveaways (such as pizza, movie nights, wings, trivia nights, etc.) this was the perfect place to spend our last year as students in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text:
Brooke,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We look are so happy you enjoy living here as your first apartment complex. We hope you choose to stay for a very long time. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to continue to make your experience great!

Thanks,
Vie Management

name: Sarah Amjad
text: The pool is awesome and they have lots of fun perks for the residents

name: Christopher (Topher) Fryzel
text: Great place with amazing amenities!  Friendly staff, too.

name: Rob B
text: I’ve lived here for over 3+ years and I’ve been pretty happy with it until recently. The new owners have made the “genius” decision to take away our cable/wifi we had with Xfinity and replace it with something called “whitesky”. Due to this, hundreds of channels are now gone and I no longer have access to several channels I rely on for sports. But hey, at least now I have three different versions of MTV and the cowboy channel... Glad to see they appreciate their residents. (Extreme Sarcasm)

resp.text:
Rob, Thank you for your review and we do apologize for your frustration. The HOA and the Board agreed to transition the cable and internet to WhiteSky because of the service that was being provided with the previous provider. The HOA has provided the channel line up, which includes many sports stations including ESPN, ESPN2, Fox Sports, SEC, ACC, Golf, and others. If you continue to have issues with the new transition that increased the internet speed significantly and adjusted the channel line up please let us know and we will notify WhiteSky to see what we can do. We look forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Vie Management

name: Lori Linn
text: My son has lived in a condo managed by Vie at University Downs for 3 years. It has been a great experience. The condo and amenities, including the 2 dog park areas and pools have been bonuses. Anytime a maintenance request has been put in, any problems have been immediately taken care of. The grounds are constantly well maintained and the office staff is friendly and courteous. We have another son leaving home soon and are confident that he will want to rent a place there, too.

resp.text:
Lori,

Thank you so much for your positive words and feedback. We work hard each day to create a great experience for all of our residents and parents! We sure are happy to have your son and you apart of the Vie at University Downs community. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to make you experience even better.

Thanks,
Vie Managment

name: Deanna Rembold
text: I’ve been a resident here for over a year and a half and absolutely love it! New management goes above and beyond to make sure you’re happy. All the amenities have been fully renovated which is a huge bonus. I would recommend anyone to live here, whether you’re a student or have a family. Plus, they are pet friendly and my dogs love going on their walks around the complex and in the doggie section!

resp.text:
Deanna,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We appreciate you and hope that you will let us know if we can do to make your experience even better! The new amenities are open and we are so excited to see everyone enjoying them!

Thanks,
Vie Management
Erin Sunderland

name: Shelby Gibson
text: I have lived here for 2 years & recently went through a rough patch with the apartment BUT the management communicated and helped me through if tremendously. This is a great place to live! The updates to the apartments are GREAT! They are attentive to your needs and want to make sure everything is a great experience for you!

resp.text:
Hello Shelby,
We're honored to be a part of your 5-Star experience, and are glad things have been communicated and will continue to be communicated to ensure a positive and happy living experience. we appreciate your kind words and will be sure to share with team. We look forward to having you as a part of our family for years to come.
Thank You.

name: Adrianne Turner
text: University Downs is a nice place to visit and the staff is really nice and helpful.

name: Clay Hodge
text: They do not send emails or text about maintenance work. I have woke up multiple times with workers in my unit without any notice, and with my lights on, door unlocked, and no one in the unit. Leaving my property available for the taking, and my trust in this place is completely gone. They cannot send a simple email or text for maintenance work but will happily run your electric bill up for no reason.

resp.text:
Clay,

Thank you for your feedback and apologize for any mis-communication. When all residents move out at the end of July our management and maintenance team are required to go to all apartments to make any repairs necessary. We apologize if this was not clearly communicated and hope that you will see increase communication moving forward. If you have any additional concerns we would like to work with you to make your experience better. As stated above, thank you again for your feedback as this only helps us make Vie at University Downs better.

Thanks,
Vie Management

name: Jenna Hall
text: THE BEST PLACE EVER TO LIVE IN TTOWN!!!!! The employees are AMAZING! I will NEVER live anywhere else in Tuscaloosa. Everything is newly updated and super clean. maintenance comes immediately and fixes everything in a timely manner. I love living at Vie!

resp.text:
Jenna,

Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We appreciate you and hope that you will let us know if we can do to make your experience even better!

Thanks,
Vie Management
Erin Sunderland

name: P H
text: One of the best places to be in Tuscaloosa. I've lived here for 2 years and the new management company is doing great things with this property. The coming renovations look awesome, and the new team is super nice and approachable. My only complaint is that the train can catch you on the way to class if you're driving, but their shuttle has gotten me to class on time without fail every single time. Really suggest that anyone who's interested in this property get in soon, I know they'll be raising the rates as soon as these renovations are done.

name: Sydney Adams
text: I’m a senior at UA and I have loved living here at Vie at University Downs. The management is so helpful and friendly and the amenities are great. There is a brand new gym and renovated pool. I feel safe living here with the 24/7 security and gated entry. I definitely recommend living here!

text: On Saturday, Jan 25, 2020, I visited this property with my daughter for housing her sophomore year at U of AL.   I am writing this review to compliment the two gentlemen who assisted us (Freddie & Parker).  I have never had a more friendly pleasant experience apartment shopping than I did with Freddie & Parker.   They were personable, friendly, helpful, patient, and understanding.   My daughter signed a lease today at this property beginning this Summer and I just hope Freddie & Parker are still there with their friendly smiling faces!  More importantly, I hope the management at this property realizes what an asset these two gentlemen are to potential tenants looking for a place to live.

resp.text: Thank you for the your feedback and compliments to our staff. We are pleased to hear how great your visit went and that we will be adding you and your daughter to our family. As a team, we take pride in making sure you feel welcomed and enjoy your visit. Freddie and Parker work really hard to make all those that come into contact with leave with a smile and a lasting memory. Can't wait to see you all during your move in.

name: Miranda Mallett
text: I NEVER leave a review on the places I stay but, THIS one is necessary! As a travel nurse, I have stayed at multiple places, however, this was, by far, the most memorable, unforgettable stay and I do not mean that in a good way! The initial phone conversation was impressive, but the “arrival” was way different. Due to covid-19, we have to be quick, ready and on the move as the demands of healthcare request….Cons: Management took no responsibility! Every concern was put off as someone else’s issue. Work orders were not completed, and I still had to pay for ½ service for a full month that I am no longer there. I had to pay for leaving 3 weeks early but did not even get a refund of the unavailable amenities (at least). Pros: they wish me luck on my upcoming assignment!

resp.text:
Miranda,

Thank you for your feedback and apologize for the discomfort you experience. The amenities opened this week as soon as we implemented precautions to ensure the safety of our guests and residents with respect to Covid-19. We are under new management and are working to ensure communication is improved for all residents and guests. We do wish you well and thank you for being on the front line.

Regards,
Vie Management

text:
This is my second year living at UDowns and I am LOVING the new renovations! I wasn’t able to stay here over the summer, but the staff kept me up to date on all of the things happening in my apartment and always asked permission before moving my things around. The maintenance staff is equally as friendly and reliable. I put a work order in yesterday and within 24 hours it was fixed.

This complex is in a great location in relation to campus, it’s pet friendly, and safe (once the gate is fixed). I would highly recommend living here!

name: Madison Ehmann
text: Vie at University Downs is the worst management company I have ever worked for. After delaying their management takeover by almost 4 months, they made promises they were no where near capable of keeping. The staff I worked with was great until Vie and their employees came to Tuscaloosa and acted like everything would be better for everyone. The renovations that should’ve been finished weeks ago are just being completed. Or, in the case of the gym, these renovations haven’t even started, which will prove to be a great disadvantage to the new residents moving in in 2 weeks. Not only has this been a major problem, but the raise is rates is absolutely ridiculous. Changing a few appliances and putting wooden floors in the bedrooms is not worth an extra $150, especially when many residents provide their own furniture. Lastly, Molly Daniels, the regional manager at Vie, had been anything but helpful in this process. She was the main person to promise all of these renovations and upgraded amenities, yet left our staff as soon as she could to return to her other company. Vie Management is a complete joke. If you can live anywhere besides University Downs, please do!!

resp.text:
Madison,

We are so sorry that you feel so negatively about your experience. We also were not excited about the closing of the property being delayed, however we have great renovations that are taking place and all of the apartments will be completed in advance of move in, which is what we communicated and promised. We have many residents already enjoying the great new environment and experience. Please feel free to reach out to our Employee Relations Manager, Jessica Drucker, to discuss your employment further.

Thank you,
Vie Management

name: Matthew Shultz
text: University downs changed management in December 2018 and boy is it noticeable. The assistant manager told someone on the phone to "f**k off" after they got an earful. Totally unprofessional. They also took away the online bill pay website previously used by the old management - but failed to tell any of the residents. They said to pay by check or in cash. Newsflash folks: if your bank isn't in town it's really really hard to find a way to pay rent, which is why the direct pay option was heavily used. Lots of maintenance problems too: the air filter in the apartment I stayed at probably hadn't been changed since the place was built because it was completely clogged. First floor apartments have bugs too. The kitchen counters are warped and starting to break, the carpets are nasty, and the cracked window in the bedroom still hasn't gotten fixed either. There's also this huge pothole in the pavement that has been there since they started using a university bus after their broke down. The list goes on and on... The rent might be relatively cheap but you definitely understand why after living here for awhile. Save yourself a headache and rent somewhere else.

name: Tarnese Price
text: Before we moved in we had to pay rent on the 1st but couldn’t move in until the 15th because they had to “clean” the apartment. We waited just to move into a dirty apartment. Nothing was prepared for us. The mailbox key was the wrong key and the mailbox was broken so we couldn’t get our mail, and of course we were waiting on something important to be delivered. We didn’t have a gate opener so we had to use a code that worked half the time. When I finally received a gate opener it didn’t work because they didn’t activate it. The gate is trash and stopped working. Then our laundry room was flooding b\c of the air conditioning. We had to call them 3 times before they actually fixed it, just for it to happen again months later. We paid rent EVERY month ON TIME but they would put all the rent either on my account or my room mate’s account so we would get eviction notices. This has happened at least 6 out of the 9 months we have lived here. Then they decide they want to take up the carpet and replace it with something else while we’re still living here!! They kept changing the date so the day ends up being on a week where I have worked three 16-hour days plus I have back issues and need an operation so I’m having to try and move all my stuff out of my room and closet so they can do something they could’ve done after we leave this place!! Which just made my pain worst. For a month or two they had no groundskeeper so there was dog feces all over the property!! Everywhere you stepped you were likely to step in it. The tub is made of horrible material and is terribly hard to clean. The faucet in the bathroom has been leaking since I moved in. The walls are thin and you can hear the people upstairs. The dryer is trash and you have to dry your cloths twice just to get them dry. There’s no button for the garbage disposal. This place is trash for the cost!! They only care about the money not the residents!! If you like to throw away money then this is the perfect place for you!!

resp.text: Dear Tarnese, Thank you for letting us know about this. Your feedback helps us get better. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business and team. Although we can’t fix the past, we are committed to improving the way we serve every customer we have. Please accept my sincerest apologies on behalf of everyone at Vie Management. Do not hesitate to contact Garrett Galloway at manager@vieatudowns.com if you wish to discuss further.

name: Sara Davis
text: new management is quick to respond and really listens to your problems. you can tell they really care about the residents and want to make sure they are happy. good location, central to shopping and UA, all the amenities you could need PLUS renovations are underway to upgrade the apartments and clubhouse

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to give us a review. We appreciate all the feedback that you have given and will continue to make sure our residents are happy with the property and management.- Thanks Managment

name: Chayton Mowrey
text:
There are so many choices for apartment living in Tuscaloosa and from what I’ve experienced, no place will be perfect in every single way. My overall experience here was above average and I did enjoy living at Vie at University Downs, but it was a roller coaster. The staff is AWESOME. Nothing else to say there, they are all really good people and willing to help. I moved in fast and it was very easy, especially from a gentleman named Rulondo who helped me numerous times during my residency. Also, I want to emphasize how impressed I was with the security in the complex. There are numerous guards roaming and keeping watch, I felt very safe here.

In the units, the floor layouts are nice and the rooms are pretty spacious, the living/dining room especially.

I did however, have a few things I’d like to share. The first negative experience I had was after I was all moved in, I realized my apartment’s living room and dining room was unfurnished. I was informed that when the new ownership took over earlier in 2018, they furnished every unit with furniture. The one I lived in however, had a resident who had been in there prior to the change in management and had personal furniture already in his room. They told him that In order to get the living room stuff: couch, chair, television, tv stand, dining room table, chairs (basically everything one would need in a living space), that he must also accept the bedroom furniture. This meant he had to move all of his stuff out of there. Since he already had everything he needed, he declined.
Ironically, the other two bedroom units were furnished but the living room was still left empty. I tried numerous times to get furniture in this apartment but it felt like the staff really didn’t care about doing this and just didn’t want to deal with it. I was told numerous times that because we had already “opted out” of receiving furniture months ago, there was “nothing they could do.” Also, I know for a fact there was a plethora of extra furniture available. I let it go because I only signed a short term lease but to me this was unacceptable and simply just laziness on the management’s part.

In October, the whole complex underwent a network change to a company called Single digits. In summation, we were without internet connection for about two weeks and even after everything was “fixed” I still experienced issues. I discussed this with the staff and I can vouch for them that they did everything they could to get it up and running as fast as possible. However, I don’t know if they made the correct decision going with this company.

Something minor, but I felt necessary to be addressed is there are a lot of bugs. I am aware this was a problem a long time ago and the staff has previously addressed this, but I still had numerous experiences. Ant infestations: One in my bedroom from the trashcan and one in the kitchen pantry. This was fixed easily by a few and traps but still gross and took a while to clean up the dead ants. I am not sure if the property had been treated for bugs but mine definitely wasn’t, not to mention that there were roaches in the kitchen, often.

After seeing what other apartment complex’s are like. Yes, I had a few complaints, but I want to make sure the management can see these because feedback is a great way to improve. Vie at University Downs does have a lot to offer and it was a nice place to live. With a few fixes and changes, this place has the potential to be a top notch choice for living in Tuscaloosa, but changes definitely need to be made. They are upgrading the clubhouse and I assume it will be very nice.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your useful insights. We are thrilled to hear that you are happy to live here, but I also wante to let you know that we are constantly striving to improve these aspects.
Best regards,
Management

text: Got new management in December 2018 that is terrible. Gave residents 2 days notice that rent could only be payed by checks when most residents are students and are from out of state. Raised rates beyond any comparable place in Tuscaloosa and are demanding all residents remove bedroom furniture for ten days while flooring is replaced with no financial compensation. New management clearly cares way more about making money than about any of the residents. I will not be renewing.

resp.text: Dear Nina, thank you for your feedback. Sorry to hear you won't be renewing your lease with us. We would love for you to give us a second chance. Do not hesitate to contact Garrett Galloway at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss how we can make things better.

name: Destiny White
text: Been staying over here at Vie @ University Downs since the fall and the new flooring just started in my apartment and they look SO good! Super excited to see the rest of the new renovations!!!

resp.text:
Hi Destiny!

Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. We are excited about the renovations as well! Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you have found this to be the case during your time with us. We truly value your feedback, If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Landon Coffin
text: I do not live at University Downs because I am local, but I have had my share of friends live there through college. I love the relaxed atmosphere and they have the most fun pool in town! The Downs would definitely be my #1 choice!

resp.text: Landon Coffin, we are so pleased you enjoyed your visit to University Downs and especially appreciate the positive review!  Please let us know if our staff can do anything further to assist you!

name: parker bearden
text: The office staff is so helpful and I can’t wait to see the new gym! The apartments also have new appliances and painting compared to most student housing.

resp.text:
Parker,

Thanks so much for letting us know everything that you like! We work very hard to make your experience the best possible.

Best regards,
Management

name: Joshy B
text: The girls in the front office were the nicest, most helpful, friendliest group of people I've had the pleasure to meet. They went out of their way to help me and I greatly appreciate it. Oh and Jade was pretty cute too😉

resp.text: Joshy B, we're so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations!  If there is anything we can do to assist you further, please do not hesitate to let us know!

name: Kory Weber
text: I've lived here for 3 years and highly recommend it to people looking for a place to live. The current staff has taken it upon themselves to personally help me with any issues and they take the maintenance of their amenities and properties very seriously. As a pet owner too my dog loves being able to stretch his legs and run around the gated park.

resp.text: Kory, Thanks so much for your positive feedback! We appreciate hearing from our residents, and we are happy to hear that you and your dog have had a great time here with us. We hope to see you soon! Thanks again! -UD Management

name: Cade Jones
text: I have lived here for four years and love it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Safe community. Fun atmosphere. Perfect for dogs!!!! A lot of land for the dogs to run around.

resp.text: Cade, Thank you so much for your positive feedback. We truly appreciate your kind words and thoughts and we are so happy that you chose to call UD your home for so long! Thanks again!! -UD Staff

name: Jake Kingree
text: University Downs is a phenomenal place to live. The location was fantastic and even allowed me to bring my pets. The staff was nothing but helpful and I will miss living in this community very much. I just hope a complex as amazing as University Downs will welcome me in my future endeavors.

resp.text: thank you so much for these kind words! We can't tell you how much we appreciate hearing from you and knowing that you've been happy during your stay with us. We are going to miss you too!! Thanks again!

name: MaryClaire Wilson
text: I had such a hilarious tour with Freddie. He was so eager to tour me even though he has a broken leg.

resp.text:
MaryClaire,

Our office staff strive to make everyone's experience the best possible, no matter what it takes. Thanks for coming by!

Kindly,
Management

name: Taylor Saenz
text: I didn’t mind living here until just recently. With the new renovations for those who are moving in is literally outrageous. They are making it such an inconvenience for me to place my dogs somewhere while they do the renovations. I work in Birmingham and I don’t have the luxury of just rehoming my dogs for the day. And on top of that they are trashing and damaging my apartment while the do it. And all they do is tell me to take a picture of it and email to the company like I’m gonna get refunded for the stuff they damaged. They are doing the renovations on my dime. They should’ve compensated those who still live here the rent for the month of July. The new staff sucks and just blows you off. Like I said I liked the place until just recently but the way the company has been treating residents is awful. Do yourself a solid and just don’t live here.

resp.text:
Dear Taylor,
Thank you for sharing your feedback and for bringing this matter to our attention. I am very sorry we failed to meet your expectations. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. You may reach us anytime at manager@vieatudowns.com. Looking forward to hearing back from you shortly.

name: Dishon Ballard
text: Its Crazy How Something As Simple As Wifi Stopped Me From Renewing With This Apartment Complex. We Been Having Wifi Problems For 3 Months And It Still, To This Day, Has Not Been Resolved. So If You Are A College Student, Dont Expect To Have A Reliable Internet Source Because The Wifi Goes Out Every Week And The Front Office Will Juss Tell You They Are “Working On It” But In Reality, They Dont Seem Like They Really Care.

resp.text:
Dishon,
We are very regretful for your experience, and our team has been working diligently on ensuring the internet/ cable is functioning properly moving forward.
Please stop by the office and ask to speak with Garrett Galloway if you have any questions or concerns.
Best regards,
Vie Management

name: Grace Costello
text: I lived here for two years and couldn't be happier! After my friends saw my place, they all ended up moving here the next year also! Great location, and great staff to help you at all times if needed! Id highly recommend these condos and apartments. i have nothing bad to say about them.

resp.text: Grace Costello, thanks so much for the positive review.  We are so happy you are enjoying your stay here and truly appreciate the referrals!  If there is anything we can do to assist you, please do not hesitate to reach out to us!

name: Justin Chavez
text: I love University Downs! The apartments are very cozy and just what i need. The pool is a great time during the summer. They also have a gym and tanning beds. The staff has always been very helpful, too! I 100% recommend the UD!

resp.text: Hi Justin Chavez, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at University Downs.  We're happy we could meet your expectations!  Please let us know if we can do anything else to make your stay more enjoyable!

name: Barry (Bj) Briggs
text: The staff is amazing,however,  the management doesn’t seem to care at all about their employees. Their singular focus seems to be getting people to sign leases.

resp.text:
Hi Barry,

Thank you for your feedback! We truly appreciate all of our team members and all of their hard work. Please let us know if you have any other concerns.

name: Samantha Quraishi
text: My niece lives here and I absolutely adore going to visit her! This property is always kept clean and their front office staff is always on top of things. I'd recommend this facility to any young adult looking for an apartment.

resp.text: Samantha Quraishi, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team.  We love referrals so please tell your friends and help spread the word about how great University Downs is!

name: DJ Lovoy
text: I loved living here! All of the staff was extremely nice to me, and the community in general is very friendly. Maintenance does a great job of actually fixing your problem when they come in to the apartment. The pool is awesome; probably the best apartment pool that I have had in Tuscaloosa out of the four different places I had lived in. Not to mention this place is a great place to live if you're a dog owner, with a dog area to let your dog run around in and play with other dogs!

resp.text: Hey DJ!!  We are so happy to hear you have loved your experience living here! We make it our priority to make sure all of our residents are taken care of!!

name: Smitty Johnson
text: The building numbers are not well marked, especially building 700 which makes no sense the way the rooms are lined out. The parking lots are not lit well everywhere either

resp.text:
Hi Nicholas!

Thank you for your feedback. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Andrew Fernandez
text: Just perfect. A friendly and efficient staff like yours is what separates you from the pack. Will definitely be recommending to friends and relatives. Great location, quality development, and an all-around lovely environment to live in.

resp.text: Andrew Fernandez, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to the team here at University Downs!  Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if we can do anything to make your stay more comfortable!

name: Daniel Skehan
text: Sydney has been one of the most helpful and customer oriented rental agents with whom i have ever dealt. Not only was she easy to work with, she was easy on the eyes. Always energetic and colorful, Sydney has made this experience the picture of what renting should be!!

resp.text: Thank you Peter Pettigrew for sharing this experience with us!  It makes me happy to hear that our leasing consultant Sydney was able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with her and the entire team.  We look forward to your next visit!  Take care!

name: Madison Fincher
text: LOVE University Downs!! Super clean, great pool, & great staff. Sydney is my go-to because she is always more than helpful!! Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

resp.text: Thank you Madison Fincher for sharing this experience with us! It makes me happy to hear that our leasing consultant Sydney was able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with her and the entire team.  We are always more than happy to assist you if anything else comes up. Take care!

name: Olivia Acker
text:
management company = 0/5 stars.

New management has decided major renovations will be completed while current tenants still occupy their apartments. The schedules provided for renovations are incorrect and they expect you to remove all furniture from rooms so flooring can be replaced and to remove everything from walls so the apartment can be repainted. Not to mention the "minor" renovations they don't even feel obligated to give notice of (ex: replacing your door and painting the new one - leaving it wide open all day).

Love the unexpected 7:30am knocks on the door "I'm here to do XYZ." Don't worry if you don't hear them or you're not home - they'll let themselves in! It's thrilling to come home and see your door wide open and people coming in and out! No telling how many different people have been given access to our apartments with no management supervision. As I type this there are people in my living room/kitchen playing music while doing heavens knows what to the AC unit.

Bringing concerns to management is useless. They are far more interested in getting these apartments updated so that they can charge future tenants $300 more in rent than they are in listening to current tenant's concerns.

resp.text: Good afternoon Olivia, Thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. I apologize on behalf of everyone at Vie Management. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. Could you please contact Garrett Galloway, GM, Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss further? Thank you.

name: Zhichao Hao
text: Withholding deposit for almost two years without any explanation! Nowhere needs this money to fix at all! Expecting to live here? Prepare to lose your money and even staffs there don't know why! All they could tell is we will work on it. Then? Your money lives in their pocket forever! I even stopped by the office and contact the Peak Campus for several times! Without any surprises, they've been making excuses all the time! Also my other friends who live in apartments provided by Peak Campus have the same experience! NO MORE UDOWNS & PEAK CAMPUS! KEEP IN MIND!

resp.text:
Zhichao,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January 2019. We hope that we will be able to assist you with your concerns and create a better living experience for you. We will be doing many renovations and strive to provide great customer service for all of our residents. Please reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com if you have any concerns that we can address today.

Regards,
Vie Management

name: The Regipea
text: University Downs is a great place to live. I have been living here almost a year and have renewed my lease for next year. I was looking for one bedrooms, and they offer the best bang for your buck, the great thing is the gated community because sometimes living alone can be scary, but with the gates closed at night, I feel so safe and at home here. I really love it. The new management has renovated a lot of things and it looks great!

name: Connor Galloway
text: Wow!  I applaud the staff, and the communities management for their due- diligences in making this community top tier. I am sure the availibility  is slim, call today for your new home!

resp.text:
Hi Connor!

Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did. Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you have found this to be the case during your time with us. We truly value your feedback, If you have further needs or questions, please reach out! We hope you have a great day!

name: Catherine Gore
text: I have lived here for a year now, and it has been great. The staff have always been helpful, approachable, and welcoming, and the apartment grounds are consistently clean and peaceful. I also love that the pool is right here and well-kept, and the gym is open 24-7. The computers and printer at the Downs was also super helpful during the school year.

resp.text: Hey Catherine,  Thank you so much for your review. We love hearing our residents experiences with us! We hope to see you at one of  our upcoming events!

name: Elena Esters
text: One of my friends has lived here for two years and she loves it. I love coming to visit because we always have an awesome time at the pool and club house! Love this place

resp.text: Elena, Thanks so much for your positive feedback! We appreciate all your kind words. Thanks again!! -UD Staff

name: Stoney Sharp
text:
The hardwood floors in the condo units sold me on University Downs.
Solid construction, endless amenities, great location, professional staff.  I'd stay another year or two if I weren't being relocated for work.  Thanks for a great stay.

resp.text: Hey Stoney,  Thank you so much for your review. We wish you weren't relocated either but we hope to have you in the near future if you get relocated back!

name: Claire Bailey
text: I have an an excellent living experience at University Downs. I feel safe and love the neighbors here. I have never had to worry about studying at home from too much noise. The staff is friendly (even the overnight security guard) and are quick to help me with my problems. I am so happy I chose to live and experience college here!

name: Alyssa Bubello
text: The staff here is great, especially Sydney! Sometimes I head into the office just to talk to her for fun. The whole place is well kept and the pool is a plus!

resp.text: Alyssa Bubello, we are glad we could help!  Feel free to stop by and say hi anytime, you're always welcome at the University Downs office!

name: Claudia Warren
text: My child has lived there for a year. The staff has been great, the complex is spacious, yet quiet. The common areas are kept clean and repaired. Plenty of parking for the residents. And the complex has a dog park!

resp.text: Mrs. Warren,  Thank you so much for your review. We love to hear from the parents of our residents and know they are happy with their children living here!  We hope to see you next time you are visiting!

name: Cody Leach
text: Internet down going on four days. Terrible customer service, and they honestly couldn’t care less. I hate living here. Highly recommend anywhere else.

resp.text:
Dear Cody,

Thank you for sharing your feedback. I apologize that we failed to meet your expectations. We are working diligently with the internet provider to remedy the outage. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. You may reach us anytime at manager@vieatudowns.com. Looking forward to hearing back from you shortly.

name: Robbie Malone
text: Looked at a two bedroom apartment. Large space with lots of storage. Rent is reasonable for the area and the staff were very helpful.

resp.text:
Robbie,

Thank you for your positive review. We are happy that you enjoy living at Vie at University Downs, where we strive to make your living with us an inspiring one. We are glad to have your testimonial to share with others to inspire them. Please let us know if there is anything else you can do to assist you.

Kindest regards,
Vie Management

name: Nicki Conlon
text: Vie Is unprofessional, With no credibility at all. Prepare to be disappointed if you work with Vie.  No one at Vie has a brokers license, and they have no respect for the  leases/contracts, as long as it benefits them. They do not manage every condo, check with Spaces and other property managers who manage some third-party condos at University Downs.

resp.text: Good afternoon Nicki, Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention. We always aim to deliver a great experience. We are gutted when we miss the mark! We will use the feedback to make us better. We would appreciate another chance to earn your trust. Please feel free to reach out to Garrett Galloway, GM at Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com to discuss further.

name: Virginia Carnathan
text: Close to campus and pretty quite. New management is great. Maintenance is pretty quick. Air company comes in frequently to check the system and make sure everything is working properly. Overall great place.

name: Tony Kirk
text: First off if i want to say university downs is not a bad place however I was put in a bad situation by them. I moved in late September to a 3 bedroom unit. However my garbage disposal has constantly went out every month, my hot water heater leaks onto the floor in the washing room and the dryer has to be rigged to keep running and this is just the beginning. I was moved into a unit that was already occupied in which it states on our move in lease if you moved in during the month of august you have 72 hours to get the lights in your name. So I think my apartment already has a power account attached to it that I just have to pay on. I gave something one month however in the month of December my power has been turned off due to it not being in someone's name. I was never notified of ANY of this and to make matters worse neither one of the two people I live with will reply to my text messages nor my calls. I'm just ready for my lease end honestly. If you already have roommates maybe it's not that bad but this is a very unacceptable situation. And to make matters worse the best option the leasing office could give me was to pay the start up fees and bill for Alabama power and bring in the bill and they will charge it to my roommates accounts. First off I shouldn't have to handle this myself, second off why would I want to continue staying in a unit where I can't get a answer from either one on A matter as serious as this. I'm the one without power right now while both of them are gone and nobody is helping me fix this

resp.text:
Hey Tony,

We are so sorry that you are having problems with your power. Please give us a call at the office at 205-752-3232 whenever you get a chance, or email me at tduncan@peakcampus.com

Thank you,
Taylor Duncan

name: Preston Schaulin
text: I went in four a tour got to see all the rendering of the renovations.Im ready to hang out in the pool all summer

resp.text:
Preston,

I'm very happy you liked what you saw. Please come see us again when ever you get a chance.

Best regards,
Management

name: Shannon Ryan
text: Love it! The staff is great they treat everyone like family and are always very cheery to talk too. Getting things fixed is never an issue if need be, the rooms are spacious, and the amenities are great! Highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you Shannon Ryan for sharing this experience with us!  It makes me happy to hear that our staff has been able to assist you.  I will be sure to share your feedback with the entire team. We are always here to help so please never hesitate to call us!  Sincerely, University Downs Property Manager (205) 752-3232.

name: BJ Robertson
text:
They had to redo the paint scheduling because one of the group of painters had got fired for stealing. The day they painted my apt, they stole some money from me. The way my money was put up(in a crate under a bunch of books), they had to been rambling through all my stuff to find it. [Smh if your 1st instinct is looking for something to steal, u don't need to be working for any company that requires coming into someone's home.] I walked up to their truck to confront them about my money missing, I notice them smoking/getting high off the money they stole from me. Of course, I reported them and they were fired immediately.
My only issue now is that it is Saturday noon and I'm just now getting my first call about roommates moving in Monday in mid July..

resp.text:
Good afternoon BJ,
Thank you for your review. I’m sorry to hear you had such a frustrating experience, but I really appreciate you bringing this issue to our
attention. We set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our business. Could you please contact Garrett Galloway, GM at Vie at University Downs at manager@vieatudowns.com? We’ll work with you to resolve any issues as quickly as possible. Thank you again for your feedback.

name: Courtney Victor
text: Overall a great experience. Were very accommodating when a personal situation required me to move apartments. The office workers are very friendly and maintenance is great and on top of things. Would definitely recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Courtney! We appreciate your kind words and we are very thankful for your recommendation. Have a great day!

text: My niece lives in these apartments, this was the first time I've ever visited. Let me say I was impressed! Perfect location and great team that keeps the place (inside and out) looking great!!

text: This is a great facility.  The staff is always helpful and polite and they keep the property clean.  And it's not very often that you find a pool that is always clean like it is here!
