text: These apartments are old , outdated , moldy , haven’t been updated in 20yrs. The carpets are dirty , bathrooms haven’t been remodeled or recaulked in 10 plus years . The doors don’t lock or work and the decks are covered in mold . They are raising the rents $200 for remodeling . Don’t let them fool you it’s for outside aesthetics only !

resp.text:
Alix,

Thank you for your feedback. You may or may not know but Vie Management purchased the community at the end of January and we are making many different changes to the apartments. The renovations will include renovations to the interior of the apartments with faux wood flooring, new furniture, new appliances and more. We will also be updating and renovating the amenity spaces to make your living experience better. If you have any concerns please fee free to reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com. We appreciate you as a resident and look for honest feedback like this to be able to implement and change things to make your experience better.

Kindest regards,
Vie Management

text: I really like living at the downs. Maintenance is fast. The area is generally quiet and very, very clean. And the parties aren't half bad either. It's definitely the best place I've ever lived. And I wish there was a sidewalk leading to campus so I could ride my bike to class. But I don't think there's anything you can do about that.

text: My bestfriends live here and I love going to the pool with them and there's always plenty of parking. The club house is huge, too. I love taking their dog to the dog park and seeing all the dogs!

text: Been living here for three years now and have never had any complaints! Office staff is very friendly and helpful. The apartments are well kept and up to date!

text:
No more amenities, not much maintenance, in fact, it's turned from a premier place to live into one where things are slowly being taken. I guess this comes from those of us who have lived here for 6 years.

Don't get trapped by the marketing. I used to give this place 5 stars, now it deserves a 3

name: Derek Jones
text: Problems from day 1.  The apartment was filthy and nothing worked on move-in day.  The water heater, refrigerator, washer and dryer all had issues.  Knobs were missing from the stove.  We just assumed that it was very busy for move-in but then maintenance told us that the apartment had been empty for 6 months so there was no excuse for issues not being addressed before move-in.  The washer and dryer never worked properly the entire year that my daughter lived there.  Repairs were attempted but didn't correct the problems.

resp.text:
Mr. Jones,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January and are looking to create a better living experience for all of our new residents. We appreciate your feedback and apart of our renovation plan is to replace appliances with new GE appliances to ensure that they are all in working condition. If you have any further concerns please feel free to reach out to Molly Crawford at mcrawford@viemgmt.com.

Thanks,
Vie Management

We can’t fix the past but since we are committed to improving the way our staff serves every customer we have put solutions in place so a similar situation doesn't happen again. name: Bree Elder
text: The amenities are wonderful and the property itself is nice, however the overall management of this property is poorly cared for. I understand there is a large amount of residents that occupy this complex, but in-turn, office workers and management should be working urgently to process maintenance requests and to solve other issues to keep PAYING CUSTOMERS satisfied with their living space. This has not been our experience while living here. My sister and I have lived with UD for almost 6 months and requests we put in those 6 months ago have still not been taken care of. Don’t bother calling the office because they probably won’t answer. And they have neglected returning promised phone calls on multiple occasions. Office is known to close earlier than the hours listed on their door/website which is inconvenient for those of us who work, or interested people traveling from out of town. It is very unfortunate because we love the property, but until management changes I believe these issues will remain the same. If things do not change soon, I foresee this complex going downhill fast in cleanliness, safety, and appeal to possible leasees.

resp.text:
Bree,

Thank you for your feedback. As you may not know, Vie Management purchased the property at the end of January 2019. We hope that we will be able to assist you with your concerns and create a better living experience for you. We will be doing many renovations and strive to provide great customer service for all of our residents. Vie Management

name: Tiffani Greene
text: I was beyond overwhelmed at the end of last spring semester with no place to live due to an unfortunate event with previous living arrangements thus leaving me with no options as to where to go for the coming semester. I went on about thirty different tours of different complexes in Tuscaloosa to view one bedroom apartments as this was my only option due to the issues I had leading me to needing a place. To say the least a majority of the apartment options in this town are sketch especially when its last minute last chance in May. However when I came to the downs, Bronson took me and my mom and sister on a tour and it was a great experience. I wanted to see the type of unit I would actually be living in as opposed to just a model unit and they understood my concerns so they made it happen. One of the other employees, Jade, let me go into her apartment and see what it was like since that would be the layout I would ultimately end up with, without hesitation or second thought. I ended up signing for this current year and have been here since August. I have nothing but great things to say about the office staff especially Andrew who truly makes anyone's day each time you see him. Being so far away from family no matter what year you are in is always hard but the staff always is so welcoming and caring. When you read other reviews they talk about disasters of maintenance and such where their needs aren't attended to but I have not seen where that's an issue. Like normal there are always going to be household things that need fixing no matter where you live, its just a part of life and being a tenant. I have had my fair share of unwanted critters (yikes its ok I am alive still) or leaks/minor breaks but no matter what the office always responded fast and urgent for me. People fail to forget that its usually just one person, Ryan, doing all the repairs so they need to cut him some slack and be understanding that the issue will be addressed quickly but maybe not immediately. As far as safety goes, I feel secure at the apartment and the one incident where I was nervous about someone near my apartment I called the office and legitimately a golf cart, and I am talking like one of those extended ones, full of staff came zooming in and investigated and checked in on me to make sure I was okay, including Taylor Duncan the leasing manager too. I find that the staff really makes the living experience worth while at apartment complexes which is why I gave 5 stars overall. I had a few hiccups here and there with maintenance or billing like I mentioned but those issues were resolved to a level of satisfaction which is the part that matters most. Now that this novel of a review is over have a great day and if you are in a predicament where you need not just a house but a home stop on over here at UD!

resp.text: Thank you Tiffani Greene for sharing your fantastic experience with us.  It makes me happy to hear that our entire staff has been able to assist you during your stay at University Downs.  I will be sure to share your feedback the entire team.  We are always here to help so please never hesitate to call us! Sincerely, University Downs Property Manager (205) 752-3232.

name: Zach Twigg
text:
Absolutely the worst experience I could've ever imagined. When I first began paperwork with them they were undergoing renovations, which at the time was exciting to see. When I came in a couple weeks later to finish my paperwork they had lost it! Papers that had my entire identity plastered all over them as well as my co-signers (parents) info! This happened TWO more times. When everything was finally taken care of I had signed during an incentive to get a $600 dollar gift card or use it as credit towards my first months rent, so being the poor college student that I am I put it towards my rent, well when it came time to pay first months rent they told me I couldn't use that incentive because I was in a privately owned unit. Why would you assign a resident who signed during an incentive special, a condo that's privately owned therefore cancelling out that incentive?

It's just one inconvenience after another with these guys. Probably because they can't get a property management company to stick around long enough for things to flow smoothly. University Downs has gone through three ownerships since I've been involved with them. The staff is almost entirely undertrained or under-qualified to be handling the responsibilities they're supposed to take care of with ease. Nearly every question is answered with "I'll have to check with my manger when they get back". Which then leads to nothing because the manager is never around.

Also if you're planning to live on the condo side rather than the apartment side then please know that all those inclusions they promise like wifi/cable or Google Chromecast are NOT included. They didn't share that until after we had signed or lease.

Truly an awful experience. Please do yourself a favor and look elsewhere for housing. Aside from the awful management the condos are higher quality builds than most of the newer places, however be prepared to do all of the move-in cleaning yourself, I've never seen such a gross move-in room. There was dog hair on the walls and black mold in my toilet.

resp.text: Zach, thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any trouble you may have had during your stay at University Downs. I hope that you are aware that we are now under new management with Peak Campus. We think that there will be all kinds of improvements for our Residents in the months to come, and we are excited to be a part of the University Downs family. Please feel free to contact us directly in the office at 205-752-3232 if you have any additional questions or concerns. Thanks again!

name: Colton Palmer
text:
It is atypical that I write reviews, especially negative reviews. However, my experience with University Downs in Tuscaloosa has been an absolute nightmare. The experience has been so negative that it warrants more than just a bad review, but also legal action.
After the new management company (Asset Campus Housing) bought the complex from Ellis-Trick, all of the services went downhill. From trash pickup to rent payment every facet of life at UD changed for the worse. Most importantly, the management staff (not necessarily the office staff) has been unhelpful, incompetent, and downright rude.
First, even though my name was on the lease (I am looking at a copy right now), my name was NEVER put into their system, so every time I called they couldn’t speak with me (or pull up my lease apparently). Furthermore, they never put any of the emails on my lease into their system. When my roommate wrote a check for $785 instead of $795 on accident, we were never notified of the “late payment” either by phone or email – even though they had both. So they after a few months that $10 charge grew into hundreds. They then had the audacity to place an eviction notice on my door. So they can walk to my apartment to threaten eviction but they can’t notify me of a $10 dollar payment??? Needless to say I paid the $10 dollars I owed them, but not a penny more! And I wished it ended there…
When I moved to a different city over the summer (and paid two rents because I didn’t want to sublease!) they actually moved another person into my apartment!!!! I found out about this when I went back to my apartment on checkout day (to turn in my key) and there was someone else living in there with all their stuff! I have had two UD employees acknowledge this, but they don’t see a problem with it at all – even though I was still paying rent!
Finally, after months of phone calls, emails, and weeks on end of no response, I still have not received my security deposit back. They have acknowledge – finally – that they owe me the security deposit, but now they said they “mailed the check.” That was over three weeks ago. This is on the point of ridiculous. The managers at the office do not care. They are rude and completely unprofessional. I have friends who have been through similar experiences at UD! And you should understand. I took pride in my apartment. It was always clean inside and out, and well taken care of.
I could go on for another page or two…
I am going back to Tuscaloosa in a few years, and they could not PAY ME to live there.
Finally, apparently the complex is being purchased by a new company in 2016. Don’t live there!!! They are keeping the same rude and unprofessional managers – so nothing will change. In fact, it will probably get worse.

text: If I could put ZERO stars I would.  My daughter moved out of University Downs last July 2016. She has been owed a refund of her security deposit in the amount of $200. We have called so many times that I have lost count, and talked to several people to try to obtain the deposit refund. The latest person I have spoken to is Vachelle,  who has promised that she will issue the check to us. I have called her four times this week, and at this point she is avoiding my calls and messages.  I guess I have no other recourse then to secure an attorney, because I have repeatedly asked for a corporate number or contact to call to have this taken care of. My daughter has lived in numerous apartments throughout her college career,  and the whole experience we had with University Downs has been the absolute worst by far.  Withholding a deposit after you have issued a letter stating that deposit will be sent is theft.

name: wilsta22
text:
Staff is awful. Maintenance would come fix some problems and ignore others. The appliances all do not work correctly. Staff/maintenance comes in whenever (literally they will knock and, from the back bedroom, not give us enough time to put pants on and go open the door before they are already letting themselves in) to fix or change things without even telling residents. They have just come in our place numerous times this year with numerous excuses. They tell you they would give residents a heads up if they have to come in, but that is not true. One day while we had multiple friends over, they came in and said they had to paint all our walls. Needless to say, that was the final straw and we told them they could not paint that day randomly without telling us, while we had people over. We live on the second story and one morning we were woken up at 8 am bc some workers had climbed up the back balconies and were on our back porch working, of course without telling us. I have never lived somewhere where maintenance just comes in without warning so many times in a year. Our friends have a joke going on about hanging at our apartment because maintenance will probably be joining us. Also, one day when they randomly came, we had an empty cat litter box. No cat, not cat toys/food, not even cat litter, just the empty box, and then they tried to charge us $500 by saying we had a pet and kept coming by randomly to catch a nonexistent cat in our place. Even then, $500 seemed like much for a cat. Another thing, along with not telling any residents about maintenance coming to do anything in residents places, they have also decided to change the internet connection and password without telling residents. We went almost a week, a school week without internet is very difficult, thinking the internet had gone out without being fixed. We finally called and they told us it had been changed. We told them we were not happy they would do that without telling us, therefore making us go without. The next day, after we had gone the week without internet and then resolved the issue, they came by and put a paper in our door telling us they changed the internet, so at least our complaining did something, even if it was a week too late.
Overall, you will not have the privacy you want in your apartment and do not count on the staff/maintenance to do great jobs. If you can get pass that, the pools and community itself is not bad, just needs better people running it.

text: I love University Downs!

name: Rhonda Ferrell
text: There was definitely some confusion about how and where to receive our room code.  Why wouldn't you get your code from the same building you're staying in?  Makes no sense to me.  Anyway, once we arrived at #2509, the ice maker didn't work and the recliner was badly broken.  I called to report both and was guaranteed someone would come to repair the chair or at least remove it.  Neither of those things happened.  My husband fixed the ice machine himself.  There was mold in the master bath shower and the shower curtain in one of the guest rooms was moldy.  There were no comforters on any of the beds but at least they were in the closet so we put them on ourselves.  Other than those things, the unit was nice and we hosted a 20th anniversary vow renewal there. A tropical storm came through while we were there so that was unfortunate but the view and the lazy river were nice.

name: Marc McGuire
text: Great view , close to everything. Very clean and terrific staff!

name: Alyssa Young
text:
Whereas the Phoenix on the Bay II seemed promising at first, our experience there was negative. The apartment itself was nice, despite the large bloodstain upon the guest bedroom duvet cover upon arrival, which the owner later accused us of causing. . The residents of the complex did not hold back in unleashing their full "Karen", and we were falsely accused numerous times by residents of the complex for "infractions", such as not cleaning up after our dogs- which was false and not supported by any evidence (we are very conscious of the need to pick up after our pets!!) This, along with a slew of other false accusations, resulted in nightly visits from security coming to our apartment to scold my parents (who are in their mid-60s) and I as if we were school children, putting a major damper on our evenings.  Whereas the security guards themselves were generally friendly, we felt as if we were unwelcome and being “watched”. We were also accused of not having “registered” one of the dogs, again untrue as they eventually admitted.

Lastly, and this may not be as important for some people, but the Wi-Fi network that is offered to guests is not secured. For people who work remotely with sensitive data, this did not provide an accommodating environment. Hours after we left the Phoenix, I realized that my Amazon account had been hacked- I am inclined to believe that this was a result of being forced to access an unsecured network.

After our departure the owner contacted us to complain about the apartment. Her claim was that our dirty sheets were not clean enough. Yes, you read that correctly. She also complained about other minor matters that were well within the bounds of normal everyday use. Next time we will make sure to take photos on departure.

As a residence that claims to be "dog friendly" it certainly is not in our opinion a welcoming place for larger dogs (over 40 pounds). We were constantly harassed and accused of things which we could prove we were not responsible for. Thankfully we were able to get away to the beach for a couple of days and enjoy the beautiful Orange Beach scenery and weather. If you are looking for a fun, relaxing and dog-friendly environment, this is not the place for you!!

name: Gina Bradley
text: We stayed in condo 2212 this week. Everything was clean. I wondered if the beds were not completely made up and finished because there were no comforters on the beds. We found They were in the closets. There was only a thin blanket on each bed. The Full size  mattresses could stand updating. They were a little thin and not as comfortable. The knob to the dryer was broken.  I had a hard time turning it on without plyars. I found out at the end of the week that the part had been ordered. It would have been nice if they could have left some tool for me to use to turn the dryer on and to leave a note explaining they were sorry and the part had been ordered. The air conditioner began leaking all over the floor. We called and the maintenance came to fix it. Hopefully for the next guest it will remain fixed. The owners need to update the tv. We rarely could get the remote to work. I had to call maintenance and they came several hours later saying it was fixed. I still had trouble with it.  It would be cheaper for them to get a smart tv and not even use cable. I like to be able to relax with the shows I watch and I couldn’t  do that. Overall it was a good trip for us. Perfect view of the pool with a large balcony. The living room furniture could use an upgrade as well.

name: T Reid
text: We would stay here again. Small beach bay play area. Nice hot tubs. Lazy river. Close to food. Nice views of the bay.

resp.text:
T,

Thank you for the review.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, as well as the amenities and area.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

name: jim wood
text: They need to get communication worked out about door codes from the main desk, but other than that, it’s a fantastic place.

name: Janice Fields
text: My 2 cousins and friend had the best experience at Phoenix on the Bay II. We stayed in #2111 and we loved our place, there was nothing that we didn't like about it.  Everything was great, the only issue we had was the tv's in each bedroom was not working and we called the number at the desk and we got Jerry with security. Jerry actually said that we were supposed to call the property owner/management to fix those type of issues. Even though this was not Jerry's job to fix the TV's, he said that he would be right down. Jerry took the time out of his schedule to immediately make sure that we were taken care of and he came right away and ensured all the tv's were on and hooked up properly. A big Thank you to JERRY with security from Kim, Janice, Terri and JoAnn for your support during our stay.  The experience there was great, people were very friendly all of the security team were friendly and we never met a stranger no matter where we went. We are looking forward to returning one day soon and I hope the experience is even greater!!! I will definitely be referring this place. KUDOS to Phoenix on the Bay II, the owner of the property and to Jerry

name: Christopher Macaluso
text:
We are rule following individuals and so are our family members. We had four separate instances where our kids were yelled at or our adults were verbally reprimanded for doing what amounts to trying to enjoy our time without bothering others. Perhaps rules are rules but if you don't apply them evenly you can expect unhappy people.

First instance, my daughter lept into the lazy river feet first to hear an employee scream top of her lungs that jumping was not allowed and that was her first and final warning. The second instance a family near us was scolded for playing audible music around the pool and for having snacks by their pool chairs. Third we had a family member have their bracelet break overnight and the front desk security guard jokingly wanted 80 dollars and bargained with me for 50 bucks before realizing it wasn't funny and offering a new one for 5 dollars. Final straw was when our family staying at the next door phoenix property were told to buy a wrist band or leave when visiting our property's pool. We verified this was ok ahead of booking, but we're lied to. Apparently there's a lawsuit between the two phoenix properties and guests of the two are the ones left to suffer.

This is the first and last time we stay here. Best of luck to the owners of condos here, because the experience is horrible.

Skip this place and find a location that's more welcoming and happy to have you there as a guest.

name: Mark Qualls
text: Wonderful place to stay! Been here 2x now and really enjoy it.lazy river is very nice, scenery is nice and close to anything you need! Security and staff doesn’t allow partiers to get out of hand in any way to keep it family friendly and safe in all situations. Would definitely recommend.

name: Becky Blades
text: Gorgeous and well maintained property. Great views, amazing pool. Staff are friendly and professional.

name: lori watt
text: The HOA nazis were in full force and extremely rude. Security people harassed my family the entire time we were there. I will take my money elsewhere and would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

name: Morgan Turner
text: we had A TERRIBLE TIME. The HOA security guard harassed us the whole time we were there. We could not do anything and neither could our kids. We will never go back due to how rude and hateful he was.

name: M
text: Horrible experience for a vacation rental. The security guard is rude and unless your an owner, expect to be treated like just a number. Seriously, there are LOTS of vacation rentals with beach front properties (it’s brackish water it looks like a lake) go to one with better customer service and view. This place is like the wanna be Beverly Hills hotel. I’m sure if you own one, the customer service is better. If you don’t, expect to be treated like it. Every year my sister in law goes to this place. Not anymore, because of the same security guard that is rude to her EVERY year. Seriously, lots of condos out there, pick one that is thankful for your business. Notice how the owner mostly replies to the good reviews? CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EVERYTHING!

name: Brishauna Coneal
text: Family friendly, welcoming, and clean. Would highly recommend!

resp.text: We are pleased to learn that you and your family enjoyed your stay here.

name: Garrett Stone
text: Quiet, luxurious, and a great view from the balcony.

resp.text:
Garrett,

Thank you for the review.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your condo and stay with us, as well as the amazing view from your balcony.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

name: Mark Santora
text: I came to Phoenix on the Bay 2 to have a great time and relax with my family. My experience was mixed. While I found Brett Robinson to be very inefficient and very unhelpful, I found the home owners association to be more than accommodating. I dealt with the property manager Michael Roberts and he went above and beyond to see that we had everything we needed. He runs the property with a great staff and despite the rough start, he came through with flying colors in the end. He answered my call on the weekend and made a special trip on a Saturday night to help us. Thank you Michael! We had a great stay and the property is beautiful!

name: Michelle Walker
text: I have always stayed at Phoenix on the Bay 2. I like to stay in the higher rated rooms but I am disappointed this time. Will not stay in unit 2107 again. This may only be my personal preference but every unit needs a update every now and then : appliances update to keurig coffee maker, freezer makes noise, blinds do not close in living room/ broke. The master bedroom blinds do not close all the way and no drape behind them. Most people like it dark when they sleep and don’t want others to be able to see in. The whirlpool tub...a child can fit in it but not many adults.

resp.text: Hi Michelle, thank you for your review. I am forwarding your comments to the department manager so that she may better assess the situation with unit 2107. We appreciate your feedback

name: Leslie McDade
text: Enjoyed it as always, loved the lazy river, glad I got my own float even with the kids there it was still relaxing. Our room had a great view didn't enjoy the guy next door smoking on the balcony.

resp.text: Leslie, thanks for the great review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay!! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Clay Piburn
text: Did some renovations on it

name: Bman16
text: Very nice place, friendly staff and atmosphere, the pool attendant was very helpful and friendly

resp.text: Thanks! We try to make our guest feel at home. See you next time!

name: Gary McKinney
text: Beautiful place! They definitely put a lot of effort into maintaining the grounds and keeping everything perfect!

name: Beth Abbott
text: Loved it!!  We stayed for 9 days and only went to the beach 1 day!!  We had everything we needed on site.  Lazy river, pool, waterslide, beach area with hermit crabs everywhere, fishing and crabbing off the pier.  Awesome place!

resp.text: Beth:  Thank you for sharing your wonderful vacation experience with us.  We are thrilled to read that you took advantage of all the wonderful things POB2 has to offer.  Please come back and see us again.

name: Kristy Seamons
text: This was our first and last visit to Phoenix on the Bay II. We were extremely displeased with the whole experience. We chose this Phoenix thinking it would be a step up from the first Phoenix on the Bay. We could not have been more wrong. The staff was very unfriendly. The room was dirty upon arrival. The appliances were out dated and didn't work very well. The lazy river and pool were dirty. The pool was small and there wasn't enough seating. Definitely put a damper on our vacation.

name: Trey Short
text: I own a condo here. This is a heavenly place. So luxurious and beautiful!

name: Jeremiah Weekley
text: Great view. Great location. Friendly staff that does enforce rules fairly stringently. Views are spectacular.

resp.text: Jeremiah:  We are happy to learn that you and your family enjoyed your stay here.  Please come back and see us again.

name: Chris poole
text: Zombie apocalypse stronghold. Boat owners hidden paradise.  Right in the heart of whos who in boat life. Look for me there if we were real life walking dead stars lol. Perfect view of the island.

name: Challie Sanker
text: Enjoyed stay here and happy with the property in general. Parking is a bit of an issue and the house keeping is a little lacking but other than those two things enjoyed this place.

name: Randy Sullivan
text: The rooms and property is just beautiful. Love the pool and lazy river. Upon arriving I had to BUY a parking pass for $20 ( really ). In a email I was told my room # was 180569...NOT it was 2202 which the lady at the desk couldn't help me with anything. My room didn't have nearly enough utensils to cook a whole dinner and the ones that were there needs upgrading in the worst kind of way .The master bed made so much noise it woke either me or my wife every time we rolled...the water line from the wall to the toilet started leaking on Sunday I told a maintenance man on the property and he said he would come fix it never showed up, Monday I fell getting out of the bed my floor was wet,  the leak was getting worst I told another maintenance man and he said I had to call who ever I rented the room through by this time the leak was so bad my whole room was full of water so I turned off the water and called the lady I rented the room from. I explained what had happened she tells me and I quote " let me call a plumber and I'll give him your ( my ) phone # so we can get this fixed....I said you must be kidding you better not give anybody my number I told her I turned off the water and cleaned up the whole room from the leak I'm not doing anything else. She never once asked me if I was ok from falling or said thank you for cleaning up the mess. I would NOT recommend this place to anyone.

name: Ali B
text:
During our stay at the Phoenix on the Bay 2, we were accosted by the pool cleaning lady and the president of the homeowners association because we were not allowed to sit in the pool area by a fountain and read a book before 9:00 am. The pool itself does not open until 9:00, but we were in NO way using the pool. Just simply wanting to sit by the fountain and read. The homeowners association lady, Pam, made sure to let me know that the general manager, Michael, reported to her so it didn't matter that I had called him. She then gave me a line about the chemicals that they were putting in the pool didn't need to have anyone around them....please. So on vacation, I was run out of a chair which was not hurting myself or disturbing anyone else.

As our day went on, we were completely appalled by the behavior that is allowed at the Phoenix on the Bay 2. Adults were throwing empty beer cans from the lazy river into the kiddie pool area and slinging beer everywhere, cussing, flipping off the security guard, Quinton, who was doing his best, blocking the lazy river, and handing out shots in the lazy river. Tons of children and families were there, but no respect was given to their needs at all. My child felt very uncomfortable in the environment and hated having to go to the part of the lazy river where the "drunk adults" we're congregated.

At no time did the pool cleaning lady or the homeowners association lady come to stop any of that. Other moms were having to take their children to the small indoor pool to get away from the "GD" word. We will NEVER vacation here again. If you are looking to book here because of the slide and lazy river which children should be able to use, go somewhere else. This is NOT an appropriate environment for children or relaxation. We felt like we were in the middle of Mardi Gras weekend swimming in a lazy river of urine because these adults just pull their coolers up to the side and stand in it drinking all day.

We were made to move from a chair at 8:00am where we had coffee and a book and were not disturbing anyone with loud music or language or obstructing anyone's way...but endured terrible and obscene behavior the rest of our time. Never staying here again.

name: Elizabeth Wilson
text: This place was amazing, loved everything, however lol if someone pays on the uper 1,400$ for 7 days I feel like it's over kill to then ask for 25$ to park and 11$ for a bracelet to swim in the pool. Maybe that's just me

name: Brianna Lane
text: Staying here now! LOVE IT. Wish the master bedroom was bigger other than that its great

name: Heather Watson
text: Excellent views. Nice lazy river.

resp.text: Thanks so much! The lazy river makes the summer heat a little more bearable!

name: JJ Sexton
text: The service and people are really nice and make it a fun easy vacation but this is 4 stars because the floor on the lazy river is way to tough and I have scraped the skin off of my toes and my knuckles from it

resp.text: Thanks for the 4 star review. We are pleased to hear that you had a great experience and we look forward to the future for another vacation.

name: Joe nash
text: Live here it is well kept and great assoviation

resp.text: Joe:  thanks for sharing your thoughts....we agree - 5 stars all the way!

name: Pam Lee
text: Nice complex but our unit was dirty.

resp.text: Pam:  I apologize if the room was not as clean as it should have been.  Our records do not show that you contacted us while you were in house.  Next time you visit, if there is anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable, please contact our service desk.  We sincerely want to make your stay as good as possible.

name: Casey Harris
text: Great place to stay

resp.text: Casey, thank you for the review.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

name: Cliff McCollum
text: Really nice!  Will go back.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Cliff. We look forward to having you stay with us again soon

name: David McLaughlin
text: Its truly Amazing

resp.text: Thanks for the Awesome Review

name: Lace Miller
text: Absolutely a beautiful place with a great view!

name: Steve Clark
text: Awesome! This will be my home someday!

name: Christina Long
text: Loved it! Quiet place convenient location!! Beautiful condos!!!!

name: Charlotte K. Kinkade
text: Awesome

name: Layla Caver
text: I loved it💕💕

resp.text: Thanks Layla! We try to make our guest at home. Hope to see you in the future.

name: Jonathon York
text: Quiet condominium complex with outstanding views

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review!  We hope to see you again real soon

name: Alayiah Bryant
text: Racially profiled!!!!!

name: FaZeCartman 1
text: Great area

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5 stars!

name: Heath Hiatt
text: Great place for a vacation

resp.text: We glad you enjoyed Phoenix on the Bay II! Thank you for the 5 Stars!

name: Gaurav Hodage
text: Great rooms and amazing location

name: Julie Weithoner
text: Love the pool

resp.text: Julie:  the pool and lazy river are one of the best here in the area.  Thanks for the review and come back soon.

name: Jane Young
text: Bomb

resp.text: Jane:  So glad to see you enjoyed your time here.  Please come back and see us again.

name: Michelle Bullock
text: it was nice

name: Teresa Marozzi
text:
(Translated by Google) The comfort

(Original)
El confort

resp.text: Teresa:  Thank you for this 5 star review.  We are pleased to read you enjoyed your stay.  Come back and see us again.

name: RVPeak
text: Fantastic location across from the beach, near restaurants and night life, plenty of amenities, we loved it.  We went there for an anniversary get away and had a fantastic time.  They even included discounts to local restaurants.  We will definitely go back again.

name: karen sepko
text: Awesome LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION for ACTION in Gulf Shores! Across from the new GULF PLACE Beach, the HANGOUT music venue, STORES, RESTAURANTS, POPULAR BARS!  Newly renovated BEACHVIEW is the place to stay if you want ACTION on Vacation!

name: John Carl Hastings
text: Had a good experience at the property we stayed in, but my son left a bunny and some books when we left and the Guest Services team went, found it, and mailed it back very quickly. Very impressed with their customer care and response and now have a very grateful 4-year old.

name: Maddox James
text: The lucky bird vacation rentals are beautiful! Absolutely family friendly, charming, and close to the beach in Gulf Shores. I stayed with my wife and son and we loved it. They were very helpful in recommending things to do in Gulf Shores. We were treated like royalty and will be sure to book our next family vacation with Lucky bird! Thank you so much!

resp.text: What an incredibly kind thing to say! Thank you so much for taking the time to write this lovely review. We were so lucky to host you and your family!

name: Andy Burk
text: Very cozy little condo. Perfect for 2 people. It's within walking distance to the beach, The Hangout, and a few other restaurants as well as souvenir shops. Definitely worth it.

name: Ashley Reynolds
text: We have been to Gulf Shores several times, but this was our first experience with Lucky Bird. We had the most incredible cottage. It was so clean, roomy and really felt like home! Elle & Betsy were a joy while booking our stay, answering any questions and gave wonderful  suggestions of things to do in the area. We will certainly be staying here again and I highly recommend this company to anyone in search of the perfect beach vacation home.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Ashley. This was such a lovely review. You and your family were amazing guests. Your sons were so adorable, lively and sweet! Your mother was a laugh a minute. We would love to host y'all again soon!

name: Mary Nobles
text: Nice new cottages great place to stay for the location on the beach . Just across the street hey hey what you say , have a great day . Ya’ll  be safe and come back now ya hear !!!

name: Derek Rowan
text: This weekend my friends and I booked a cottage with lucky bird vacations and stayed at Coconut Cottage in Gulf Shores! We could not have been more happy with our stay. It was right across the street from beach access so we spent a lot of time by the water! We would 10/10 recommend this rental if you're looking to visit.

resp.text: Derek, you are beyond amazing for your lovely review. Thank you for taking the time to do so. Y'all were so amazing! We would love to host you again!

name: Ashley Oneal
text: We stayed at the Beachview 200 with Lucky Bird Vacations and it was nothing like we expected or even like the pictures. We were very disappointed when walking into our condo. As soon as we walked in we began searching for a broom/mop to clean the floors. The shower floors were very dirty as well. This will not be a condo we will book again.

resp.text:
Hi Ashley

We hate to hear your experience staying at Beachview 200 was not what was expected.  If we would have been contacted upon arrival, we would have been happy to contact the outsourced cleaning company to come back and correct any issues upon arrival. Also, we were not aware the broom and mop were missing. We appreciate the heads up and will be sure to have replaced promptly. Again, we apologize for any issues you had during your stay. We would have loved the opportunity to correct all issues while you were here to ensure your vacation was a success.

name: Charles Beale
text: Beach view is a great location everything is all around you here within walking distance of condos beach is right across the road

name: Kimberly Alsbrooks
text:
We stayed at the East Point Cottages, Fantasea cottage.
The wifi did not work.  We called the management,  and were told it was an HOA issue. Communication with the management- Betsy or Allie- was largely ignored.
The cottage was nice.  The kitchen chairs are odd, small and uncomfortable.   There is a small loveseat for 6+ people to share.  The kitchen barely has the necessities for cooking.  The ice maker does not work.  Buy ice!  Bring your own plates, cups, utensils, laundry soap, dishwasher soap, paper towels, cleaning products- including toilet paper.
There should be an outside shower somewhere,  but there is not.  There is an outside spigot for you to wash your feet.  There needs to be some outside hooks for hanging towels, etc.
Let's talk about location.  The cottages are all in a row from the main street.  If you book, ask exactly how far the cottage is from the main road.  You have to walk across a very busy road to get to the beach.  The walk is fairly short, but would be a challenge for little ones.  Not sure where the pic of the road in the ad came from, but it is misleading.
Don't bring a toddler here.  There are stairs EVERYWHERE.  If you have limited mobility folks in your group, book elsewhere.
The swimming pool is tiny and there is not a shower to wash the sand off before you get in.  Yuck.
Overall, we have a fantastic time.

resp.text:
Hi Kimberly, in regards to communication, I have responded to each email sent over the weekend and called the internet company to see if it could be fixed remotely. Unfortunately, they could not so the next slot available was the next business day. The other homes internet should be in range to use as well. If ever an issue, we can usually pick up from one next door or straight across.  I doubled checked our email system report status of each emails sent out to see if reported sent/viewed. All were sent out but not viewed,  so that may be to why you didn't see the information provided about the internet issue.  Also, we keep a FAQ sheet in our homes with contact number for internet on the weekends for after hour issues.  Both Ally and I were at the cottages several times over the weekend, either of us would have been more than happy to bring ice for you or ran to grab some, had we known it was an issue when dropping off other items requested. The after hour number is the best source to text or call, which is our main number. The number is also provided via emails, website, or in house information sheets for any emergency issues such as water leaks, a/c issues, electrical, or plumbing.  We will be sure to have our maintenance take a look since we are now aware its not working properly. We send out check-in instructions with list of all items to expect upon arrival, which is one set up of household items. This list can also be viewed in the rental agreement, FAQ sheet and terms and conditions as well. I will look into other ways to push the information out in the future to help clarify.  We appreciate the suggestions for the outdoor items and will relay to the owners as possible items to add over the next year.
Lastly, we have several photos, videos, and detailed descriptions of our properties in order to ensure every guest is aware of locations and layout of the cottages. Our photos show different angles from different homes interior and exterior.  Video wise we have several tours of the homes and walks to the beach. The walk from the back entrance less than 2 minutes and from the front entrance 1 minute and 30 seconds. Upon arrival at the red light to cross over, the city installed a cross walk, revamped the side walk area which is over 6ft wide, and dropped the speed limit to 25 mph to ensure safety for all crossing to beach areas. Again we do our best to portray our properties as is and to provide more than adequate information readily available on several platforms for viewing.  We are always happy to answer any questions if any still are left unanswered.

name: Kimberly Kreates
text: Very unsatisfied. You have to wash your own towels, tidy up and bring cleaning supplies, and the rooms are small. They say it's a one bedroom when it was just a studio. You have to pay a cleaning deposit for the maid to clean up after you, but she never comes in. So Do NOT stay here.

name: Faye Jordan
text: This beach condo is amazing! It is very clean and decorated as you see in beach side magazines.....so charming. I will definitely stay here again.

name: Bake It So
text:
Fun fact....The Hangout, a bar/restaurant stays open till 1am on Thursday and Fridays and midnight on Saturdays...they like to play base filled music too that you can hear from this particular “condo .” I used to clean condos and this place is not a condo. It’s an efficacy apartment (smaller than out room at Drury Inn in MS) with poor quality wiring. My father has been in construction his whole life and taught me a great deal. There were SO many concerns with the  room we stayed in. When we called a nice maintenance man to come figure out why our lamp wouldn’t turn on we found out the wires were loose. I mentioned it being a fire hazard and nothing was done.

**HOWEVER**

It was in the middle of everything, had a well lit parking area and an elevator. Our kitchen was cute and the beds were decent.

name: Bonnie Carr
text: Condo waa fine. The fact that there was no mention of not being able to drive or walk near the condo due to set up for hangout fest was not okay. The constitution noise and sound checks way too late on Wednesday...when the fest starts on Friday...also not relaxing. The harassment by rent a cops for walking down the street is beyond irritating. Just don't come near this place a week either side of hang out fest.

name: Allen Williams
text: For the price it was great. Wish they had balconies, but it was still ok for 2

name: Mark Allen
text: 322 was perfect,  All they said it was ,Location ,Clean, Internet and  cable

name: Troy D.
text: Good for couple,close to beach, Depends on room you get. Good stay for price if your not looking for a beach view.

name: Troy Persyn
text: Small,  book directly if you do use them. Huge price premium if you book via Expedia or the like .

name: steve anderson
text: Studio was adequate,  somewhat cramped but we would rent again.

name: Becca L.
text: There is no internet or pool like advertised.  But at least the ac works.

name: Michelle Bracke
text: What a great place!

name: james gillum
text: Great location.

name: Gerald Edwards
text: Horrible I would never stay there again.

resp.text: Hi Gerald, we hate to hear you had a horrible stay. I researched my reservations and did not see a reservation under your name at any of my properties in the past year.  Possibly the reservation was under a different name or confusion to which company managed the rental booked. Again, we are customer service driven, we would have been happy to assist at anytime during your stay.If you indeed did stay at one of our properties. Thanks Lucky Bird Vacations

name: Beachball Properties
text: Check out our units 221, 305, & 306

name: Howard Hayakawa
text: Quiet, clean, well appointed

name: Amanda Eddington
text: Great location!

name: Derrick Cullen
text: No swimming pool, but the management staff is great.

name: Emily Ramay
text: The cable wouldn't work, no DVD player, the electronics door lock messed up so many times a locksmith had to be called and a regular doorknob put in.

name: bobbi closser
text:
I left feeling restored from the mandates of life and like I gained a friend in Taylor and in Bella Beach Properties.

The space was fun and functional (working remote, cooking a meal, ordering in, watching a movie)! The view from the patio of the 15th floor was even better in person!

Taylor and the team were amazing!  From answering general questions to responding to a maintenance request, I felt well taken care of.  I even forgot some items in the medicine cabinet on day of check out and Taylor called immediately to inform me and connected with his staff so I could quickly arrange for pick up.

My only regret is that I didn’t make it to Floribama! (Guess there’s always next time)!!

Bobbi

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words. We loved having you. I must share a quick story. The day before Bobbie departed, our cleaner arrived to a condo that was left in such a complete disaster that it brought her to tears.  The next day, she went to clean the condo where Bobbi had stayed. Our cleaner said “if every guest was like this person I would be in heaven”. Bobbi left a nice note for the cleaner and left the condo spotless. It made her day. Thank you for being so awesome! We looking forward to your return visit and yes, we too feel we have a new great friend.

name: Comedienne Joy
text: I highly recommend contacting Taylor Means with Bella Beach Properties for your next vacation stay. He over surpassed what I was looking for with my stay at The Palms in Orange Beach, Alabama. The condo was not only clean, but quiet and I felt safe.  Taylor provided excellent customer service when I asked for food recommendations and somewhere to get my external harddrive repaired. I'm using his service for my girl's trip and a family trip later in the year. One of my bff's took his information for a future birding trip she is coordinating. The Palms is a great location as it is in close proximity to shopping and restaurants.

name: Lela Holland
text: It can really get busy during weekdays lunch hours. I usually prefer to order online. The food is really good including their salads, wraps and kebabs. Staff could be more courteous.

resp.text: Unfortunately, this review will lower our rating even though it was not about our business. As much as we love salads, wraps, and kebabs, we don't serve them.

name: Jan Garey
text: Had a horrible experience with AirBnb and Ana grime Tradewinds on my trip to Orange Beach, Al. Taylor, Jeff and Mary are the best to work with. Personal service with integrity, honesty and ethics. I will gladly be using Bella Beach Properties on my return to this area.

name: Tim Frey
text: Bella Beach is always responsive, friendly and honest.  Bella Beach is by far the best rental management company we’ve worked with over the last 20 years.  We will continue to use Bella Beach and recommend them for you and your family.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and glowing review of Bella Beach Properties. Providing friendly, top-notch service to both our clients and our guests is our #1 priority. We are thankful to have you as a loyal client and value our relationship.

name: afzaal lodhi
text: We had joy we had fun staying in your place clean and what a location thanks a mil next visit for sure we are staying with Bella properties thanks again

resp.text: Awesome! Thank you! We loved having you and look forward to your return visit! We appreciate you mentioning the great location and cleanliness of the space.

name: Gabe Johnson
text: Best time of my family's life  perfect view of the ocean 🌊 we will definitely go stay there again

resp.text: It makes us smile and makes our day to get feedback like this. Thank you for entrusting your family vacation to us and we look forward to your return visit.

name: JIM CLATER
text:
We love Orange Beach and Taylor
Means provides great customer service.

name: Tracey Young
text:
If I could give them less than a star I would. I rented a property with them, Plantation, in Gulf Shores. Fifth floor steps from the beach, elevator, and tuns of amenities.  Not what I got.

What I got was a broken elevator carrying bags and extras up 5 flight of stairs not my idea of fun.  Trying to contact our host Mary for hours and got no response.  She could care less that it was 7PM, I had been in the car with kids for 8 hours and I was not happy.

Good thing I rented through Airbnb and they were able to find me another rental. I would not recommend Bella to anyone. They were not professional and the property was not as advertised.

name: Lisa Bogle
text: Easy booking, prompt responses, clean and comfortable rental.

name: Donna Nunnelley
text: Bella Beach Properties is the best property management on the Beach. Call Mary Cain Fowler. You will be pleased that you did.

name: Andrew Voelter
text: Do not book through them!!  The condo we rented was filthy. Over all, completely neglected. Master bed sheets had to be 5 years old, hair and stains on them when we arrived. Real nice to find at 10 pm after a long trip. Leaking toilet, non draining tub, highly stained outdoor couch, broken patio lounge chair on the balcony, missing outlet cover, missing closet door, washing machine noise that sounded like it was going to explode at any minute, highly stained carpet. I could go on. Worst of all...we emailed them with concerns (photos attached to help them, we thought) and not even a response!!!!! Nothing!!!! Even after my wife spoke to them...Nothing!!! They obviously do not care about their renters. Stay away!!

name: Samantha Frasier
text: There were 7 of us that took a girls trip and stayed at the palms unit 304...we all had a great time and really enjoyed this condo. I will definitely use Bella beach properties again!!

name: Mary Edwards
text: Love Bella Beach Properties! Taylor and Cady are so hospitable and knowledgeable! Highly recommend!

name: Dave Lyon
text: Beautiful people helping you vacation.  The staff is awesome.

name: CJ
text:
Mary Cain Fowler is the best. Have used Bella Beach Properties numerous times in Orange Beach and would recommend them to all.
The company is run with the highest standards and I can not Thank Mary and Tyler enough for all that they do for all of their clients. Not so much as clients, but all are treated as family.

name: C W
text: I have written many time asking for details and have only heard. Ack once in the past 6 months and was told they would write me back. I have stayed here many times but as of now will not book anymore with them.

name: Paula Granberry
text: Taylor and Mary were very helpful in finding the perfect condo for our family vacation.  We chose The Tidewater condominiums for its ideal beach location convenient to restaurants and activities for the family.  I would highly recommend the personalized service at Bella Beach.

name: Randy Curry
text: We stayed at the trade winds condos. The property is nice. But the customer service from Bella was awful. We never received an email or any information on how to check In. Only a automatic reservation confirmation payment confirmation. Called several times, left messages, emailed and never got a response or a call back. Finally someone texts from someone on how to get in. They really should provide more information to those who rent a condo.

name: Tonya W (the Sassy Puffin)
text: I had the best getaway to Orange Beach last week! I stayed at The Palms on Perdido Beach Blvd., a spacious 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom condo overlooking the gulf. Nice location. Would definitely go back.

name: Justice Wally
text: Excellent Realtor and very knowledgeable of the Orange Beach and Gulf Shores area.  My wife and I recently purchased a home in Orange Beach and Taylor Means was very helpful and patient in our home search.

name: Denny Harms
text: Bella Beach Properties is amazing. 3rd year in a row booking our Spring family Vacation with these guys and they will be our choice for years to come!!!

name: Amy Barclay
text:
Stayed with Bella Beach.. it was the nasty place I have ever stayed!  We had to go
buy sheets to put over the furniture because they was so dirty and smelled so bad.

name: Jonathan Cannon
text: Our family stays with Bella Beach Properties every time we visit Orange Beach or Gulf Shores, Alabama. Bella Beach Properties always delivers a great condo for our vacation!

name: Taylor Means
text: Bella Beach Properties offers beautiful, clean gulf front condos with excellent customer service!

name: Zac C
text: Very polite, very professional, and the condos are great.

name: Ryan Miller
text: Beyond rude and it was dirty so many difficulties even getting into the right condo. They just kept messing up our reservations then turned into a screaming match and told we were lying and that we are all fine and should just enjoy the beach even the patio doors to the balcony locked us out. I understand the property has wonderful views. However, this is not how you treat the guests. Even if the property owner was at fault, you decided to manage the property, you are responsible for taking care of the guests. Due to the horrible experience we left and stayed somewhere else the second night. Even a simple apology and explanation would’ve helped. Instead we just get called liars and to get deal with it. Should I also mention that there are 3 small kids here and the fridge was full of beer when we arrived? And the balcony door automatically locked if you went outside? How is this a way to manage?? All I wanted was help and what I received, was exactly the opposite.

name: Paige Finson
text: It was a nightmare trip to say the very least. The management has no customer service skills at all and screams and argues with guest. Taylor was the worst never stay with them !! The place was dirty and they couldn’t even get the condo number right. We tried talking about our complaints then told we are wrong and was yelled at and wasn’t allowed to talk. Don’t waste your money for the good views stay else where !

name: Mark Carter
text: Had an awesome time at the beach this week. The condo was great and Taylor was wonderful to work with. We were a little high maintenance but he took great care of us. The last place we stayed in with another company was a disaster. We were so happy we decided to use Bella Beach this time. Would highly recommend. 🏖

name: Mark Emanuelsen
text: Great rental experience and the staff were very responsive on questions we had. Will definitely be rented from them again!

name: desi brooks
text: This was my first stay here and I was absolutely impressed. The condos were clean and spacious and check in was easy and accommodating. Quiet and peaceful stay with nearby stores. Definitely will stay here again in the future.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Brooks for the kind words, we hope to welcome you back in the not to distant future.  Have a great rest of the summer.

name: Cierrab Cierrab
text: I enjoyed my stay here ..place is very nice

name: charmaine dodd
text:
Great service.
Always a fun experience

name: Pete Cesere
text: Great place to eat.  $$$ but good portions.  Good service.  Good bread.

name: Karen Lakey
text: Comfortable place enjoyed my visit

name: Rachel Jethroe
text: Love this place
